89001.name: Introductory Set
89001.description:
Publisher blurb

If you haven’t tried SkeletonKey Games’ best selling e-Adventure Tiles yet, now is your chance. This set contains 25 brand new miniatures-scale tiles in three of the most popular e-Adventure Tile terrain types - Dungeon, Cave, and Wilderness.

Are you already an e-Adventure Tiles aficionado? The tiles in this set are new, unique, and compatible with the sets you already own.

89002.name: Scenes of Space Hex Battle Maps
89002.description:
Publisher blurb

Fight your battles on scenes of space. Fourteen scenes for your sci-fi space battles to take place in. Escape an exploding planet, dodge ice asteroids, navigate a nebula, or traverse the stars with a distant galaxy in the background. Two scenes laid out for large printers. Twelve pages laid out for letter/A4 paper. All images have a 1" hex grid. Play your sci-fi games with dramatic backgrounds.

User comment

Please note that while the majority of the pages are 8.5" x 11", one page is 18.5" x 18.5" and another is 17.5" x 20.5".

89003.name: Minute Dungeon
89003.description:
Publisher blurb

If you're tired of using 2-D scenery mats for your encounters and want that added something that a third dimension gives to roleplaying but have found 3-D scenery fiddly and difficult to assemble then Minute Dungeon is just what you need.

With simple step by step instructions and simplified designs you can rapidly make section after section of this modular scenery.

More importantly, Minute Dungeon enables you to rapidly set up and change your dungeon floorplan to accommodate those fast moving PCs - layout elaborate dungeons in minutes!

This PDF contains everything you need to build that special dungeon for those special moments:

a long corridor model
a short corridor model
a small corner model
a small T-junction model
a small crossroads model
a large corner model
a large T-Junction model
a large crossroads model
three additional doors to enable you to customise the look of your dungeon
and finally a floor texture mat to enable you to turn the empty spaces between your halls and corridors into rooms




The scenery is all designed from high quality photo based textures and scaled to standard 25mm figures. Each model has 1 inch grids for ease of miniature movement calculation. Each model has simple step-by-step instructions with photographs and can be constructed from 80gsm paper - saving you the hassle of buying you heavier card.

89004.description:
Rally Point is a series of scenario packs for Advanced Squad Leader. This issue contains 10 scenarios and is a special study of the U.S. Army's 45th Infantry Division

The scenarios are:

RPT41 Sicilian Debut
Ponte Dirillo, Sicily, 11 July 1943

RPT42 Piccolo Peak
Calore River, Italy, 13 September 1943

RPT43 Thunder in the Valley
Teleset, Italy, 12 October 1943

RPT44 Purple Heart Alley
Venafro, Italy, 4 November 1943

RPT45 Operation Buffalo
Campoleone Station, Italy, 23 May 1944

RPT46 Ghosts of Meximieux
Meximieux, France, 1 September 1944

RPT47 Black Edelweiss
Reipertswiller, France, 16 January 1945

RPT48 Firestorm
Aschaffenburg, Germany, 29 March 1945

RPT49 Spring Cleaning
Bamberg, Germany, 12 April 1945

RPT50 Nazi Town
Nürnberg, Germany, 17 April 1945
89004.name: Rally Point Volume 5: The Thunderbird Pack

89005.name: Rio Draco Base Set
89005.description:
Publisher blurb

Welcome to RIO DRACO pilgrim! The Rio Draco base set kicks off Fat Dragon Games new line of wild west terrain. This starter set includes everything you need, six unique buildings, each with multiple texture options, 3D boardwalks, balconies, hitching posts, water troughs, out houses and even a covered wagon!

This set included:


American west style ground tiles including multiple detail options.



Stream and pond tiles



Bonus 2D tiles for building layouts



Sheriff's office



Saloon



Dry Goods/General Store



Hardware Store/ Trading Post



Gun Shop



Bank



Outhouse



Covered Wagon



Hitching posts



Water Trough



Building texture options that YOU customize



Full color beginners guide

89006.name: Neotech Overdrive
89006.description:
user summary

Short instruction on how to convert characters and adventures from Neotech 1 to Neotech 2.

Distributed as free PDF

89007.name: Fort Triside
89007.description:
Publisher blurb

Fort Triside is a paper model to be used in any 28-30mm wargame for inexpensive terrain. Easily builds in a couple of hours, lasts for years, build as many as you like. Give your game table an intersesting lookout or check-point on the frontier.

The model comes with 9 pages of photo guided instructions; 18 pages of the main model; several pages of options; and more pages with alternate skins for the main model. Choose wood textures for that rugged, outdoorsy look. You can also choose metal textures in four popular "faction" colors. For ease, the model can also be built without the hillside and spikes for an even quicker build of a fort at ground level. One PDF and you are able to build a fort on the cheap as many times and in any look as you need.

89008.name: Neotech Showdown Berlin
89008.description:
user summary

Instruction adventure for Neotech 2. Was initially included in the boxed version of Neotech 2, but was later (2002) sold separately

The game is set in a runned down and brutal Berlin. The players think a break in at a film team will solve all their problems. To late they realize what they have started...

89009.name: LEGO Indiana Jones: The Original Adventure & Kung Fu Panda
89009.description:
User Summary

A compilation bundle pack of LEGO Indiana Jones: The Original Adventures and Kung Fu Panda.

89010.name: Dungeon Siege: Throne of Agony
89010.description:
Dungeon Siege: Throne of Agony picks up where Dungeon Siege II for PC lefts off: after the second cataclysm altered the world of Aranna. A new threat appears out of nowhere, and the player has to chose one of three characters to oppose it. Wild monsters attack elves and humans, with the one behind this menace being known as the Black Druid. The player has to face many different creatures before the Black Druid is located and killed. It turns out that the true enemy are Vagar, a race of corrupted beings of whom Black Druid was a member. They serve their mistress, Malith, once a leader of Agallan giants, now a fallen creature who takes its powers from Throne of Agony. The hero has to defeat Vagar, find the Agallan giants, and ultimately defeat Malith. Finally, the player has to decide what to do with the Throne of Agony, a sentient throne of darkness, as it could be either used, or destroyed.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dungeon Siege: Throne of Agony", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89011.name: Atari Classics Evolved
89011.description:
As we live in a world where video games look as real as live television, who would have thought that it all originated from Pong? Classic games like Pong, Centipede, and Battlezone began a video gaming revolution. Atari, the video game pioneer, is bringing back these and 8 other 2-dimensional classic games, giving it an updated look for the 21st Century and introducing a new way to play them.

No need to dust off your Atari 2600. These classic games are now available for you to take everywhere you go on the PSP© (Playstation©Portable) system. Whether you’re looking for that classic, retro experience, or you’re looking for new-age graphics, each game will be playable in both classic and evolved forms to satisfy your itch. As an added bonus, you’ll be able to unlock over 50 Atari 2600 titles giving you non-stop gaming action.

Asteroids - Shoot down flying saucers before they shoot you. Asteroids was originally released in 1979 and was quickly a hit in the United States, becoming Atari’s best-selling game of all time.

Asteroids Deluxe - Asteroids Deluxe was produced in 1980 as the sequel to Asteroids.

Battlezone - Drive your tank around the battlefield, fire your gun and destroy the enemy tanks. Battlezone was released in 1980 and is widely considered to be the first "virtual reality" game.

Centipede - The Centipede is attacking and you must destroy all the segments before it reaches the bottom of the garden and takes you out! Centipede was released in 1980.

Lunar Lander - The first carbon-conscious game! Land you craft on the craggy moonscape, but try to use as little fuel as you can. Lunar Lander was released in 1979. Though it never equaled the success of Asteroids, it has always retained a strong and loyal fan-base.

Millipede - Released in 1982 as a sequel to Centipede. Shoot the garden nasties and watch out for the Millipede!

Missile Command - Defend the cities and don’t let the nukes take out your missile stations. Released in 1980, Missile Command was a huge hit, often providing more revenue than contemporary machines until the mid-1990s.

Pong - Well, what can we say about this classic that you don’t already know? Pong was released in 1972 and is the oldest game of the collection. It’s a classic that never grows old.

Super Breakout - Move the bat and deflect the ball. Released in 1978, Super Breakout was microprocessor-based arcade game, as opposed to the discreet logic used in the original Breakout.

Tempest - Destroy the baddies as they make their way toward you. Tempest, released in 1981, was the first game to allow you to choose your starting level (a system Atari dubbed "SkillStep"). This feature increased the maximum starting level, depending on your performance in the previous game, essentially allowing you to continue — a feature that became a standard in later video games.

Warlords - It’s like Breakout, but with four players. Defend your base and destroy the others. Warlords was released in 1980.

Atari 2600 (Unlockable) - To unlock Atari 2600 games, you must earn all four awards for each of the main games.

Source: The Publisher Website.

89012.name: Pure & LEGO Batman
89012.description:
User Summary

A compilation bundle pack of Pure and LEGO Batman: The Videogame.

89013.name: Star Wars: The Clone Wars & Tetris Worlds
89013.description:
User Summary

A compilation bundle pack of Star Wars: The Clone Wars and Tetris Worlds.

89014.name: Forza Motorsport 2 & Marvel: Ultimate Alliance
89014.description:
User Summary

A compilation bundle pack of Forza Motorsport 2 and Marvel: Ultimate Alliance.

89015.name: Viva Piñata & Forza Motorsport 2
89015.description:
User Summary

A compilation bundle pack of Forza Motorsport 2 and Viva Piñata.

89016.name: Monsters of the Savage Snow
89016.description:
Monsters of the Savage Snow: The Wanderers Guild Guide to Frostbound Organisms

From the back of the Book
Amid the stark, unforgiving landscape of ice and snow one can hardly be expected to find an abundance of life, yet that is precisely what I, Lord Sir Edric Morgandale, legendary explorer, nobleman, and Wanderers Guild Member in Good Standing have accomplished! Within these excerpts from my personal journals you will find details of dozens of bizarre creatures highly adapted to this stark environment, some that even thrive here. Here too, nestled among my notable exploits, are tales and poems from the hardy peasants that dwell along the costs of living ice; tales of legendary beasts, immortal heroes, and ancient civilizations awaiting discovery.

Only one such as I, Lord Sir Edric Morgandale, blessed as I am with my powerful intellect, indomitable spirit, and unyielding thirst for knowledge and discovery, could hope to survive such trials and privations as await those who wander the lands of unforgiving ice. Indeed I was the only one willing to go! Armed with only three galleons of peasants, servants, and men at arms, I boldly strode forth, armed for battle against the legions of ignorance.

Monsters of the Savage Snow: The Wanderers Guild Guide to Frostbound Organisms is a compendium of arctic monsters for the d20 game system. Presented in the unique Wanderers Guild style of in-character narrative and sidebar game information, this volume makes a valued addition to any collection. Add it to your Archives today!

89017.name: Who'd You Rather?
89017.description:
Who'd You Rather - The Ultimate Adult Party Game

In this game you attempt to be the first player to reach $1 Million by performing risque activities or by betting on the sexual preferences of other players in the following categories (as taken from the rules):

1. Pics - Some are hot, some are not - but you must choose one!
2. Celebs: This category compares two well-known celebrities.
3. Turn Ons/Turn Offs: This category is all about the things that might get you excited...or disgusted!
4. Down and Dirty: This category lets it all out. This is where other find out what you're really about - between the sheets, that is.
5. Anything Goes: This is the action category. You'll get to see people do things you never really thought they would do.

Each turn, The active player spins to see which category they must follow. They will then be asked to perform the action required to earn cash, or select their preference of two options (A or B) presented. They choose between A or B and place their answer card face-down in front of them. All other players also place an answer card in front of themselves with the answer they think the active player chose. Bets may be placed on answers to increase the money earned by a correct guess. The active player must reveal their answer and explain themselves. All correct players earn $50K plus whatever they bet. Incorrect players lose any money they wagered.

The game includes different pics/question card sets for people who prefer men and people who prefer women.

89019.description:
The game consists of a special die and a set of tiles. These depict things that dogs do (sniff, pee, run, etc.). In the basic game, the children take turns picking up a card and acting out the action. Then they can keep the tile. At the end of the game, the player with most different card colors is the winner.

In a competitive variant, the players take turns rolling the die. A player rolling a dog symbol can pick up cards and act out the pictures and keep the tiles until another player rolls the dog symbol. The player with most tiles at the end of the game is the winner.

(user summary by HilkMAN)
89019.name: Schnuffi, wuff!

89020.name: thru-the-portal (Issue 4 - Q4 2010)

Contents:

Articles in this issue:

89021.name: East India Company

videogameexpansion.106424: East India Company: Battle of Trafalgar

89021.description:
East India Company is based on the history of European conquest of South Asia and Southeast Asia by means of their East India Companies. In the game, the player takes on the role of the Governor Director of the East Indies. The task is to conquer the East Indies and establish a trade empire to rule over all others.

The game features real-time naval combat when enemy ships engage the player's fleets, and real-time land combat when the enemy tries to invade one of the player's colonies. East India Company combines trading, naval warfare, and management. Players can create a fleet to conquer the enemy with powerful warships and privateers.

Source: Wikipedia, "East India Company (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89022.name: Intergalactic Quest: Slaves of Devron
89022.description:
A choose-your-own-adventure book featuring full-color art on each page.

From the back of the book:

For millennia two generals have been fighting each other for control of the planet Devron. The losers in this war are the armies, unwilling combatants to a man - they are the slaves of Devron. Can you free them and end the planet's bloody civil war?

89023.name: Intergalactic Quest: Cosmic Triangle
89023.description:
A choose-your-own-adventure book featuring full-color art on each page.

From the back of the book:

No ship which has traveled to the Cosmic Triangle has returned. Your craft is programmed to investigate. Using its replication system it changes into a meteor and travels into the very heart of darkness. Will you survive the journey?

89024.name: Intergalactic Quest: Doomed World
89024.description:
A choose-your-own-adventure book featuring full-color art on each page.

From the back of the book:

Caught up in a time travel experiment, the planet Droxius 8 is in a state of cataclysmic regression. Unless something is done it will drag the rest of the galaxy back with it. The future is in your hands. Can you save the universe?

89025.name: Intergalactic Quest: Kidnap in Space
89025.description:
A choose-your-own-adventure book featuring full-color art on each page.

From the back of the book:

Ruthless spacepirates [sic] have kidnapped Prince Meelo and taken him to Hadezz, one of the most dangerous planets in the system. The odds are stacked against you and time is running out. Can you rescue the Prince and live to tell the tale?

89026.name: Panzer Campaigns: Kharkov '43
89026.description:
A Panzer Campaigns title focusing on the battles around Kharkov during the mid to late winter of 1943.

From the Designer's Notes file included with the game files:

THE CAMPAIGN

Kharkov ’43 was the final successful operation for the Axis forces in Russia. It marked the end of the Stalingrad tragedy and the prelude to Kursk. It was a sweeping campaign, with large distances and low unit densities making it more akin to a desert campaign than the Eastern front.
This operation was actually the Third battle of Kharkov following on the German capture of the city in September 1941 and the Soviet attempt to recapture the city in May 1942 (as simulated in Kharkov ’42). There was a Fourth battle of Kharkov in August 1943 where the Soviets liberated the city for a final time in the Polkovodets Rumyantsev offensive post Kursk.

When looking at this operation it became apparent that there were three distinct phases in the battle.
• The Soviet Offensive
– The Star & Gallop operations, Feb 2nd to Feb 19th.

• Manstein’s Backhand blow against South Western Front, Feb 20th to Mar 5th

• The German recapture of Kharkov and the shattering of Voronezh Front, Mar 6th to Mar 18th

89027.name: Getting The Goods - Everytown Scenario #2
89027.description:
Publisher's blurb

Getting the Goods is the second in a series of adventures centered around the Everytown setting for Twilight: 2013.

It is a straight forward recovery mission, with complications. The PCs will be challenged to come up with creative solutions on a number of levels. Alternatively, they can bull their way through, kill on the way in, and kill on their way back. They just might not make it, though.

89028.name: Geschenke aus Gottes Hand
89028.description:
Card game where the player with the fastest reaction wins.

In the game there are 12 different "pairs" like: cow --> milk or hen --> egg. The first cards ist called start, the second gift (from god). Every player has a set of 12 gift card oppen in front of him. Now 1 start card is turned over an all players (wihtout the player turn over), try to find the matching gift card first to win the start card. After all 36 start card are played, the player with the most card earned wins.

89029.name: Kommissar Rex: Wer stahl den Kohinoor?
89029.description:
Row of four cards (A,B,C and D) should be built in the center of the table. On your turn you can play one of your 6 handcards. Start a row with an A or build on en existing row. On the card there are colored lines. A card can only be added if it has the same color as the last card of the row.
There are also jokers.
The player laying a D card gets the row as points and a player who can exchange a joker get the point for the exchanged card.

This is branded with the sheperd dog "Rex" from the TV show "Kommissar Rex"

89030.name: Würfel-Wörter
89030.description:
Five dice with letters are rolled. Now every player tries to build a word only with thes five letter, bur can use the five letters as often as they wish. The player rolled can use one joker letter.

Write down your word an put it in the game box. If all players but one wrote down a word the words will be scored. Each word is one point per letter plus a bonus for beeing fast.

89031.name: Twilight: 2013 Web Supplement - Adventure Seeds
89031.description:
User summary

Twilight: 2013 Web Supplement - Adventure Seeds is a free PDF file that contains 14 half-page adventure ideas.

89032.name: Twilight: 2013 Player Characters - Americans
89032.description:
Publisher's blurb

The following characters can act as ready-made PCs or as supporting roles as star NPCs for a GM to use in any number of scenarios. Most location and event details are intentionally left vague to allow for their introduction into a number of storylines taking place within the USA or storylines requiring an American character or two.

Each character writeup contains a detailed history, stats and equipment for both a beginning character and an experienced one.

The first in the Player Characters line deals with 5 playable Americans:


Bruce Miller (Male) - A long haul trucker looking for his family
Sarah Jenkins (Female) - A linguistic analyst for the CIA
Daniel Morris (Male) - A prison guard looking for work
Wendy Simmons (Female) - A conspiracy theorist searching for the truth behing the Twilight War
Roberto Gonzales (Male) - An Army artilleryman doing his duty

89033.name: Colorado

videogameversion.77302: English/UK DOS Action Sixteen floppy edition

89033.description:
From the back of the box:

The ultimate in wildwest adventures takes you where only Indians and wild animals have dared to venture. Canoe the rapids, climb mountains, jump rivers, struggle in armed combat and above all survive...

89035.name: Gunboat
89035.description:
From the back of the box:

Gunboat. An agile arsenal that can turn 29 knots in the swat of a mosquito. Eight tons of firepower crammed into a 30 ft. hull. For three decades, the U.S. Navy has deployed the river patrol boat (PBR) for a most hostile and claustrophobic type of war. River combat.

89036.name: Twilight: 2013 Stage I Rules
89036.description:
User Summary

The Twilight: 2013 Stage I Rules are the minimum rules set required to play Twilight: 2013.

This book contains:

Setting information
Character creation rules
Dice mechanics
Combat rules
Equipment
Medical care rules
Radiation rules

89044.name: Ultima IX: Ascension – Dragon Edition
89044.description:
User Summary
Being the last part of the Ultima series (and the conclusion of the 'Age of Armageddon' trilogy), this is a special US exclusive version of Ultima IX: Ascension that was especially made in honor of the 'Ultima series' fan club, called Ultima Dragons. It was released after some time the initial standard edition.

See version info for more details on this.

89046.name: Dragon Surprise
89046.description:
A memory game. One player has the green knights, the other the blue knights. In your turn you first have to turn over a knight in your color. If not just turn hide the card and next player's turn. If you find your knight, you turn over cards as long as you find a dragon. Then a fight will happen. You roll dice for your knight and the other player for the dragon. For a killed dragon you get a treasure.

This game is limited to 100 copies.

89047.name: Trolls and Tribulations
89047.description:
User Summary

In this cross between Super Mario Bros. and Tutankhamun, you guide your character through several side-scrolling mazes, jumping from platform to platform and shooting little baddies and kicking their eggs off into the water/lava (a la Joust), dodging indestructible red skulls and gathering keys and treasures. It's a primitive game. The finesse is not in the movement but the timing. Could be addictive to those that like this sort of thing.

89048.name: Spellbound Dizzy
89048.description:
User Summary

Dizzy is back on his fifth adventure, and this time he must fix his own mistake. While visiting his good friend the wizard Theo, he stumbled upon Theo's Book of Really Powerful Spells and despite the warnings, he read out loud one of the pages, sending all his friends and the wizard to the Underworld. Now he must travel to the Underworld himself, rescue the yolk folk and Theo and find a way to send everyone back.

This game has the largest map of all the games in the series (over 100 screens). The graphic engine was redesigned by Big Red Software, including changes to the user interface like an icon-based inventory system. Gameplay-wise, the game is similar to the other Dizzy games with its mix of puzzle and platform action.

89049.name: Armored Assault
89049.description:
From the company website

Armored Assault Tank Simulator brings you right into the action on the ground during WWII like never before. Face off against the enemy in the most heralded tanks of their time. Storm the opposing forces strongholds with massive firepower, or lay in wait along a supply line, poised to take out your foe with one stunning shot from cover.

89050.name: The Tale of Beta Lyrae
89050.description:
User Summary

This Scramble/Vanguard clone puts you at the helm of a side-scrolling space ship zooming over randomly-generated landscapes populated by targets and obstacles. The big challenge comes because every so often, your ship will accelerate and decelerate wildly for no apparent reason. The gameplay is lackluster, but the music is annoyingly catchy.

89051.description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

"Enlightened Warlords is a 64-page book supplement for Soldier Kings, our multi-player game of the Seven Years’ War. It includes game strategy for all eight Major Powers, a history of the Seven Years’ War, and a number of new variants to spice up your game:


National Aspirations. Austria can win the game by capturing Martinique — but Maria Theresa wanted Silesia, not some Caribbean island, no matter how valuable it might be. Each Major Power receives a new set of national objectives unique to itself and usually conflicting with someone else’s goals.



Special Powers. Prussian counterfeiting, France’s free press, Austria’s Military Border and much more. Each Major Power becomes even more unique in play.



Pre-War Options: Habsburg Spain, the Maratha Empire, Bonnie Price Charlie. How would each of these unusual events have impacted the next generation?



And Lots More Options: Tropical diseases, national finance limits, supply, capital cities and on and on."
89051.name: Enlightened Warlords: A Player's Guide to Soldier Kings

89052.name: The Church
89052.description:
Publisher's blurb:


God rules Mythic Europe in awesome majesty, served by the angelic hosts. For most people, however, the majesty of the local bishop is awe-inspiring enough, and God is served by the priests, monks, and friars who share their communities. The Church touches every aspect of life, and every individual heart. Even magi in their covenants must contend with the Church, and many trust it with the salvation of their souls.


This book provides background and rules for the Western Church as a human institution, covering the organization of dioceses, monastic orders, and daily devotion. It also describes the role of women, and looks at the Knights Templar and Franciscans in more detail. As a human institution, however, the Church is not immune to corruption, and so this book also discusses how some of the great orders of the Church might fall to the Infernal. Bring the faith of your characters to life!

89053.name: Legends of Hermes
89053.description:
Publisher's blurb:


Throughout its history, some members of the Order of Hermes have stood out from their peers, whether for their brilliance or for their sheer stubborn pursuit of a goal. They are the legends of the Order, whose tales are still told and even emulated by lesser magi. And some of these powerful wizards have left legacies that have yet to be fully uncovered.


Legends are never complete. This book details five such magi from across the Order's history:


a brilliant researcher who extended Hermetic theory
a master of spirits
an advocate of peace on the eve of the Schism War
an obsessive constructor of magical defenses
and the flamboyant master of a flying castle


All have left treasures behind — treasures waiting to be found by living magi!

89054.name: Endless Ocean
89054.description:
Endless Ocean places the player in the role of a scuba diver exploring the Manaurai sea in search of sea life and sunken treasure under the guidance of an assistant named Catherine Sunday. In the sea, they will encounter a number of marine species ranging from smaller fish and penguins to massive whale sharks, manta rays and humpback whales. The range of marine wildlife in the game is extensive and includes many common and rare species. The player will also encounter dolphins and other cetaceans that can be trained to perform certain tricks and become companions on dives. Species such as sharks are also present; however, they pose no threat to the player. The player also has access to a large aquarium that they can populate with species they have identified. The sea's various locations provide a means for the player to experience general diving, cave diving, deep-water trench exploration, wreck diving and other activities that might not otherwise be possible in a single real world setting.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Endless_Ocean,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89055.name: Dizzy: Prince of the Yolkfolk
89055.description:
User Summary

The sixth instalment of the Dizzy series see Dizzy trying to escape the underground prison Rockwart the troll threw him in and rescue Daisy from the sleeping spell that's been cast on her.

The game's user interface is almost the same as the one featured in Magicland Dizzy (most of the elements introduced in the fifth episode have been removed). The gameplay is similar to other games in the series, a mix of inventory-based puzzles and platform action elements.

89056.name: Mecha Press (Issue 1 - Jan/Feb 1992)

rpgissuearticle.24372: And Now for Something Completely Different

89056.description:
From the cover:

• MS Gundam Special
• Introduction to Battletech Revised Edition

89058.name: Mecha Press (Issue 3 - May/Jun 1992)
89058.description:
From the cover:

• Gundam 0080
• VOTOMS
• More on Techno Police 2100 AD

89059.name: Taktik
89059.description: A two player abstract game played on a 7 by 9 array of hexes. Each player has four pegs of his colour on the specified starting hexes. On his turn a player may move any one of his pegs any distance in a straight line but may not jump any other peg. The object of the game is to be the first to get all four pegs of your colour in a straight line. They do not have to be adjacent but there must be no opponent pegs between them.

89060.name: Mecha Press (Issue 4 - Jul/Aug 1992)

rpgissuearticle.24412: A/C and Missile Rules for Battletech

89060.description:
From the cover:

• Bubblegum Crisis
• Gundam 0080 Synopsis Part 3+4
• Mekton 3D Optional Rules

89061.name: I was an Atomic Mutant!
89061.description:
From the creator's website:

"You are the monster!! A smashing and stomping homage to 1950's b-movie monsters.

Arcade style gameplay through virtually limitless levels.

Play as one of four powerful monsters: The Brain from Beyond Infinity; Reptomicus; the She-Beast; or the Invader from Dimension X.

Live the movie as you play in original black and white, and unique "Canopy-Vision" cinematic mode.

User summary:

An arcade stop 'n' Smash game where you take one of 4 monsters and destroy every building in a level to move to the next level. Monsters are on a Godzilla scale, and all are based on 1950s movie monsters - the 50-foot woman, Godzilla, etc. Your weapons include eye beams, Stomp attacks, ray guns, etc, varying according to the monster. Opposing you are infantry, tanks, aircraft (varying from P-51 fighters to B2 bombers), etc. Powerups are sprinkled around the levels, and the game offers a variety of (mostly cosmetic) options such as playing in greyscale or 'canopy mode' (which displays the screen as though it was on a drivein movie screen.

Plays in Windows 7, possibly without compatibility mode, but better in Windows XP SP3 mode.

89062.name: Letter Heads
89062.description:
Four different letters games can be played with the components included in the box:

1) Letter puzzle - longest possible word (Deal 9 letters onto table and all players use these letters to find the longest possible word. Players get 1 point for every letter in their word.)

2) Word builder - create as many words as possible using 3 random letters (Deal 3 letters onto table and players have 1 minute to create as many words as possible containing these letters. Players get 1 point for ever unique word they come up with.)

3) Word paths - search for words in a four by four grid (Create a random 4 by 4 grid of letters and players then find as many words as possible in the grid, similar to Boggle. Players gain 1 point for each unique word they find.)

4) Word crossing - use as many letters to make a crossword layout (Players are dealt 21 letters and have 5 minutes to create a crossword grid using these letters. Each player scores as many points as letters they use.)

89063.name: ROLLE|SPIL (Issue 4 - Winter 2010)
89063.description: Cover photo by Peter Munthe-Kaas. Cover model is Maja Toft Løvbakke.

89064.name: The Last Mission
89064.description:
User Summary

The machines have become sentient and have decided to get rid of all organic life on earth. The surviving humans, gathered on the planet Nova, have come up with a desperate plan. Their last creation, the robot OR-CABE-3 is sent to Earth to steal the blueprints of the machines' central complex. OR-CABE-3 has succeeded in its mission but it must now escape from the enemy underground base and return to the surface, where a shuttle to Nova awaits.

The Last Mission is a side-view arcade game in which the player must explore 94 different screens full of traps and enemies in order to escape. The OR-CABE-3 robot is armed with a laser and can detach its head to visit screens where the rest of its body can't follow. While detached, the robot head expands energy and must soon return to its body. Any hit with an enemy or a trap and the player is sent back to the first screen of the game.

89065.name: Paradox
89065.description:
This is a very strange card game. In the deck are 8 cards of this values: +1,+2,+3,+4,-2,-3.
Shuffle the deck an everybody gets 4 cards. Turn over the deck and do what the card says. If it is a positive card you as many cards from this deck. If it is a negative card you discard that number to the discard pile and add the negative card. When the deck runs out turn over the discard pile and go on. When all card are in the players hands, all positive cards count negative and the negative cards count zero.

89066.name: Thunderbirds
89066.description:
From back of US NES edition box

FLY WITH THE BEST

In the future, combat pilots do battle in the air, under water, deep within the earth and far into outer space! Are you tough enough to join the Thunderbirds, the world's elite fighting force?

Five different fighter craft, like the Mach 20 Thunderbird 1 Rocket, the Neptune Hydro Turbojet, and the Fire Flash Atomic Plane. If you're a red-hot ace, you'll find dozens of secret weapons and special power-ups. War zones of the future include explosive volcanic deserts, deadly ocean depths, and the stark terrors of space. Lots of cool enemies, including poisonous space scorpions, fire-spitting volcanoes, mutant sea-worms, and dozens more!

89067.name: Super Pitfall
89067.description:
From back of US NES edition box

Join Pitfall Harry as he searches a vast subterranean cave dwelling high in the Andes. Harry's mission is simple -- recover the Raj diamond.

Interested in helping out? Perhaps a few details, before you volunteer.

You'll have to be in great shape. The full extent of these caves is unknown, and you must be prepared to explore every square foot to succeed.

So, a little dirt, a few cuts and bruises and total physical exhaustion don't scare you? OK, how about poisonous frogs, bats, snakes, scorpions, tarantulas, cave-men, lava pits and deadly condors?

Oh, did we forget to mention Harry's niece, Rhonda, and his faithful companion, Quickclaw the Lion? They're both trapped below and must be saved before you can leave the caves. Just a minor complication.

Still with us? Good. Because it gets better and better -- over 270 screens loaded with danger and adventure. New enemies and challenges at every turn.

Sound like your cup of tea? Then step forward and join Pitfall Harry in the greatest adventure of his career.

89068.name: Super Psychic Chibi Fighters 3
89068.description:
From the promotional site:

"SPCF3 is an action-packed, light hearted game of head to head combat. Frantically blast through the enemy while dodging an onslaught of hazardous attacks, all while saving up power to unleash game-changing special attacks on your opponent! Two players can play on a single iPad, and a complete game takes only a few minutes! Easy enough for the casual player, yet deep enough for the strategist, Super Psychic Chibi Fighters 3 is a game you won't be able to put down!"

89069.name: Mario Madness
89069.description: Super Mario Bros branded card game. A mixture of rummy and canasta. You have to collect set and straits to get points. There are also some special cards.

89070.name: Monster Trix
89070.description: Super Marion Bros. branded card game. On the cards there are Monster in different numbers. All players turn over one card from their own deck at the same time. If there are 6 or more monsters of the same kind, you have to slam pn the table to get all open cards. If you run out of cards you are out.

89071.name: Saturday Night Live: The Game
89071.description: Based on the long-running Saturday night sketch comedy show, this board game has the players break up into teams to collect cards, won by completing a series of challenges based on various aspects of the television show. The challenges include trivia questions and impersonations of cast members, and are categorized by the "era" of Saturday Night Live they are drawn from.

89072.name: blau - gelb - rot - ...
89072.description:
The smallest memory game ever. There are three discs, each with a different color underneath: blue, yellow or red.
You roll a die (blue, blue, yellow, yellow, red, red).
You show the disc with this color and put the disc somewhere back on the table. If you choose the wrong one you have lost.
Surprisingly someone will make a mistake. Should be played really fast.

89073.name: UNO: England FA
89073.description: An England Football edition of UNO with 112 custom cards featuring England players. In addition to the normal UNO cards, there is the "Goal" card which allows players to swap a card with another player.

89074.name: jUX
89074.description: The board constist of two long rectangles forming a "X" and an "U". On your turn you add a piece in your color at the end of the "X" or the "U" or the cente of the "U". When all spaces are filled you get a point for each majority of the rectangles of the "X" and the "U". Most points win.

89075.name: Orthogo
89075.description:
The board is a square seperated by othogonal lines with 24 crossing points. The are pieces in three different colors. At the start you have to put 2 pieces of each color on the board, so that not two of the same color are adjacent. Each player gets 6 starting pieces.

On a turn you have to put a piece adjecent to one of the same color and then you have to move the adjacten same colored pieces. If there is a piece on the space you have to move to, this piece is beaten. You have to take on of the beaten pieces back.

The player who got rid of all his pieces first is the winner.

89076.description:
In front of the island of Pirate Fishbeard lies the ship of some other pirates. They want to steal the gold from Fishbeard. But the slope of the pirates is so unstable that it can fall over. Each player has to remember how heavy the gold boxes are so that they don't make the slope fall over whenever the pirates transport the gold to their ships!

Children can learn to add up and subtract weights with this game.
89076.name: Schätzinsel

89077.name: Arabian Lords
89077.description:
Arabian Lords is a PC strategy game originally released by Quirkat in 2007.

Travel back in time and become an enterprising merchant lord during the Rise of Islam. Start with one palace and expand to rule an entire city! But beware the perils of power – as you gain prestige you must outmaneuver and defeat other rival factions. Will you rule an empire powerful enough to fend off the invading Mongol hoards?

Craft your beautiful Middle Eastern city!
Send Beggars, Thieves and Vandals to sabotage your opponent!Hire Musicians, Poets and Bards to keep your markets thriving!

Source: The Developer Website.

89078.name: Lost Tomb
89078.description:
User Summary

Yet another in a long run of Atari maze games. Take on the role of an intrepid explorer as you go through the maze-like ruins of Egypt, dodging poisonous arthropods and menacing mummies to gather keys and treasure. Use your limited dynamite reserve to blast away monsters and walls.

89079.name: Descent Maximum
89079.description:
Descent Maximum is the PlayStation counterpart of Descent II on the PlayStation. Unlike the first PlayStation Descent which was considered mostly a direct port, Descent Maximum was designed to better accommodate the console and contained 30 entirely new levels. These maps had similar themes to those in Descent II, but were generally smaller than their PC cousins.

Source: Wikipedia, "Descent II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89080.name: Sally
89080.description: A memory game with 4 different ways to play. There are 48 different cards in 6 different colors and different numbers. In one variant you have to find a card in the color roll with a colored die, in another you have to build a sum rolled with a d10.

89081.name: Bluffi
89081.description:
A memory, bluff racing game. A racing track is built with 24 tiles. The tiles are hidden on the hidden side are values: -3,-2,-1,+1,+2,+3,+4.
On a game board are 8 other hidden tiles with dice values 1,1,2,2,3,3,4,4.
On your turn you turn over one of the dice tiles and move your pawn the number showing and put the dice tile in another storage. Then take the tile you are landing on and look secretly what is on it. Now you declare what you have seen an move according to what you said.
If another player does not believe you he can call you bluff and the tile is shown. Whoever is wrong has to move 5 spaces back.
After 8 turns the dice tile sotrage is gone and now we play with the other storage.

89082.name: Pang-Dang
89082.description:
40 cards with circles on them divided into 12 parts. Each part is colored in one of the six colors lay on the table.

One of the other 40 cards (exactely the same but a bit larger) is revealed and you have to find the matching cards fastest.

89084.name: Amok
89084.description:
Every player is a street-builder adn tries to build new streets. But every player has also his own spaces he tries not to be overbuild. The players try to overbuild the other players' spaces.

In the game there is normal movement, but also "Amok" movement. If you are in a rush hour you will go amok and now it is easier to build new street in your rampage.

This is a last man standing (means last player with noch overbuilt spaces) game.

89085.name: Unterwegs mit Paulus
89085.description:
This is a biblical cooperative game, where the players try to form new christian societies while traveling through the eastern mediterranean.

When all players are die or imprisoned the game ends and you score how man societies you have build.

89087.name: X-Men
89087.description:
X-Men is an arcade game produced by Konami in 1992. It is a side-scrolling beat 'em up based on the characters of the same name under license from Marvel Comics. The animation of the X-Men and the supervillains are based on the 1989 X-Men pilot episode titled X-Men: Pryde of the X-Men. A HD port of the game by Backbone Entertainment was released on PlayStation Network and Xbox Live Arcade on December 14, 2010 and December 15, 2010 respectively.

Source: Wikipedia, "X-Men (arcade game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89088.name: Cycle Tour
89088.description:
Free-download cycling game made in Melbourne (Australia). The pdf provides game board, player tokens, chance cards and shopping cards, and you will need to supply a regular deck of cards from which you will remove the jacks, 3's,and 2's, as well as the jokers.

Players use the cards to move their pieces around the board and collect shopping cards as they fall on green squares. Blue squares are special “chance squares” where players get cards.

There are 2 winners in this game, the person who completes 5 laps first and the person who has the highest value of shopping when they finish 5 laps.

89089.name: SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs Tactical Strike

videogamehonor.32746: 2009 British Academy Game Awards Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee

89089.description:
SOCOM: U.S. Navy Seals Tactical Strike focuses on the player being able to maintain tight control of a four-man special operations squad. The game represents a major departure from the "run and gun" gameplay of the previous SOCOM games. In Tactical Strike, the player himself is never able to physically shoot, run, etc. Instead, he or she must tell the squad to do such actions. The player is often has to evaluate a situation and then plan accordingly, usually having to incorporate some stealth into his or her movements. The squad is moved around using a "skimmer" (the analog stick of the PSP); the player can preview where the individual members of the squad will move to before they opt to actually move the team. The squad can be controlled from the points of view of different soldiers; additionally, the four man-team can be split up into two teams of two. The player can even choose to select an individual member of the squad.

At the start of the campaign, the player chooses from one of nine special forces teams to command: the Australian SASR, the German KSK, the British SAS, the French GIGN, the U.S. Navy SEALs, the Spanish UOE, the South Korean 707th Special Missions Battalion, the Italian Col Moschin, or the Dutch KCT. Although the storyline of the campaign is the same for every team, the voice track is voiced by native speakers of the different languages (with English subtitles).

Before each mission, the player can choose the loadout and accessories for each individual, upgrade each soldier's attributes with skill points obtained from previous missions (skill points are awarded for killing enemies and completing objectives), and choose one of two places to insert into the mission(if applicable).

Source: Wikipedia, "SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs Tactical Strike," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89090.name: Penny Arcade Adventures: On the Rain-Slick Precipice of Darkness – Episode Two
89090.description:
Penny Arcade Adventures is an adventure game which mixes 3D gameplay with 2D interstitials and cinematics. The gameplay consists mostly of seek-and-find puzzles, reminiscent of adventure games, where the player must collect items and return them to a character to advance the plot. They can also collect spare robot parts to upgrade their weapons. Battles consist of a real time combat system similar to the ATB system of Final Fantasy Games, with context sensitive button presses reducing damage or being used to carry out special attacks.

Source: Wikipedia, "Penny Arcade Adventures: On the Rain-Slick Precipice of Darkness", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89091.name: Thonahexus 8

rpgissuearticle.94007: And then we hire a pilot...

89091.description:
Starting from this issue Joe Adams replaced Justin Howe as co-editor.

Contents
2 The Town Cryer Presenting an assortment of stray thoughts and random ideas
3 The Ring of Halgrim Adventure seed
4 Maritime Campaigns Two gamemasters’ reflections
6 And then we hire a pilot... Pilots, merchants and the organization of trade in south-western Harn.
14 Sins of Scenario Writers Views on adventure writing from an alternate reality.
16 Building a Manor A short explanation of how long, it takes to build a manor.
27 The Horn of Skargja the Wise An adventure seed for Ivinian players.
28 Seldholm (Ambergaun) Setting: an Ivinian thran

user comment
much of the art is uncredited, (Uncredited) is listed as an artist

89092.name: Thonahexus 9

rpgissuearticle.94016: Analyzing the Kaldoric Succession Crisis: The Prelude

89092.description:
In this issue Lucas Brusquini can be seen as editor. This is however the same person as Lucas the Lucas as started this fanzine, only with the new name.

Main focus this issue is on succession crisis and its application in gaming.

Contents
2 The Town Cryer Presenting an assortment of stray thoughts and random ideas3 Running a Succession Crisis (Kaldoric or Otherwise) A method for approaching a Succession Crisis campaign.
11 Why Write This ? Or, You’re Ruining It For Me ! Different approaches to a Succession Crisis.
15 Reactions of other kingdoms The Kaldoric troubles will not happen in a vacuum.
16 Analyzing the Kaldoric Succession Crisis: The Prelude A thorough analysis of the players and motives of the Kaldoric Succesion Crisis
47 Zerula Setting
52 The Khuzan Diary Adventure seed.

user comment
much of the art is uncredited, (Uncredited) is listed as an artist

89093.name: AlterEgo (Issue 2)
89093.description:
Contents
2 Ledare Editorial
3 Brev Letters from readers
4 Att bygga det perfekta spelet To create the perfect game
7 Das Schwarze Auge About German RPGs
8 Glittrande ögon Adventure for HarnMaster

89094.name: AlterEgo (Issue 3)
89094.description:
Contents
3 Projekt Altoria Description of project to create a new RPG world based on Drakar och Demoner
5 Myten On myths

89095.name: Arkham Detective Tales (Extended Edition)
89095.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Cyclopean skyscrapers, bizarre cults, strange foreigners and eerie alleyways - the city of New York stands on the threshold between the modern age and the Mythos. No-one in the NYPD speaks of it, but everyone knows that certain neighborhoods are to be left alone and that there are worse things than criminals in the shadows. Only the foolhardy or the desperate follow the trail down these haunted streets.

A new, extended edition with fully updated content and a brand new adventure set in Arkham. This volume includes five labyrinthine and spine-chilling mysteries for your Trail of Cthulhu investigators!


The Kidnapping: An infant has been snatched from the cradle. Can the investigators track down the kidnappers before the parents are forced to pay the ransom?
The Book: Two men die under similar circumstances within a day of each other, victims of a serial killer that stalks New York. As the investigators delve into the mystery, they discover the perils of learning too much...
The Wreck: The tramp steamer Star of Mauritius is discovered drifting in the harbor. Her crew are all dead or missing. What secrets lie within her rusting hull?
Return to Red Hook: Thomas Malone led the police into the slums of Red Hook ten years ago, and dozens of officers died there. Now, the horror at Red Hook has returned, and once again New York’s finest must risk their lives amid the crumbling bricks tenements.
New! The King's Men: Detective Thomas Tably commits suicide under suspicious circumstances. Papers found among his belongs put the investigators on a trail that leads to historic Arkham and the dangerous Miskatonic Island cult.


The Investigators are law enforcement agents and their civilian consultants, answerable for their actions, but will the full force of the law be enough to stem the tide of the Mythos?

89096.description:
Setup: Charisma can be played on various sized boards. A 6x6x6 or 7x7x7 hex hex board is recommended. Each player has a plentiful amount of their own colored pieces.

Goal: The player with the largest group wins. If tied then another equal or second largest group wins etc...

Turn: Place one of your pieces on the board or strike with one already placed. If you cannot do either then you must pass. Passing is otherwise not permitted.

Place:
one stone anywhere on the board not adjacent to any other stone.

Strike:
The striking stone moves in a straight line and may not pass through any other stone.
The strike value must be equal to the number of stones in the target group.
strike value = number of spaces moved + number of stones in the group(s) adjacent to the departed space.
Upon striking, the target group is converted to the color of the striking stone.





End: when both players consecutively pass or when it’s clear who will have the biggest group.
89096.name: Charisma

89097.name: EA Sports MMA

videogamehonor.31899: 2010 Game Critics Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee

89097.description:
The Definitive MMA Experience - Featuring multiple disciplines, rule sets, locations, and fighters from, the worldwide sport of MMA, all represented authentically. Throw down in a ring, hexagonal or circular cage. Environments come to life with ring girls, corner men and the best referee in the business - Big John McCarthy. Ring announcer Jimmy Lennon Jr. provides fighter introductions, while MMA legend Frank Shamrock and Mauro Ranallo call the action.

EA SPORTS Live Broadcast - Create your fighter, post a hype video online, enter the cage and fight it out in front of thousands of online spectators with live play-by-play in EA SPORTS Live Broadcast.

Total Strike Control - Go on the offensive with Total Strike Control; an intuitive control system for striking, elbows, knees and kicks. Total Strike Control is accessible via analog sticks or face buttons, providing the utmost flexibility.

Advance Defense System - The best offense is a good defense, so get ready to master parrying, slipping, countering and dodging to gain an advantage over your opponent.

Feel the Fight - Controller rumble acts as an alert to simulate body movement when an opponent attempts to advance position. Take notice and use the small window of opportunity to counter or defend.

Submission Battles - Using an intuitive system, opponents must strategically manage their advances or counters to secure the desired outcome; button mashing is the road to failure. Properly manage your stamina because in MMA you must be as smart as you are strong.

Travel the Globe - Visit the most established gyms across Japan, Brazil, Thailand, and the United States to learn new skills and techniques in career mode. Bring a created fighter up through the ranks to attempt to make one of biggest stages in mixed martial arts - STRIKEFORCE. No career mode will ever be the same, ensuring a unique experience each and every time.

And In This Corner - EA SPORTS MMA will feature a vast array of fighters in its roster, including the #1 heavyweight in the world Fedor Emelianenko. MMA legends Randy Couture and Dan Henderson, as well as international stars Shinya Aoki and Ronaldo "Jacare" Souza showcase global variety. Every fighter will use their distinct style and fight like their real-life counterparts.

Source: The Game Website.

89098.name: GURPS Supporting Cast: Age of Sail Pirate Crew
89098.description:
It's time to raise anchors and rig the topmasts; adventure awaits! GURPS Supporting Cast: Age of Sail Pirate Crew presents you with a new group of "friends" who are perfect for all your maritime mercantile machinations. This seafaring supplement includes:


A look at the pirate's life, including shipboard organization and the logistics of a less-than-legitimate lifestyle.
Full GURPS stats for nine members of the 30-man crew of the Adventurer's Revenge, as well as three job templates to flesh out the rest. Plus, everyone on ship is provided with a name and home port; no one is faceless on this ship!
Complete GURPS vehicle stats for their swift seafaring sloop.
Alternate uses for this crew in any campaign. Give them different roles (such as smugglers or privateers), put them in different locales (including the Mediterranean or Indian Ocean), or even use them in modern or space-opera settings!
Ideas for customizing the crew's stats with additional advantages or disadvantages, so no two scurvy dogs need to look alike.
Adventure seeds and ideas for working this pirate crew into your games – as enemies, rivals, or even allies!


While Supporting Cast: Age of Sail Pirate Crew has been painstakingly researched for realism, it's also perfectly suited for more "cinematic" campaigns. Regardless of how you use the versatile vermin contained herein, it's time for eyepatch, parrot, and plunder!

89099.name: GURPS Low-Tech Companion 2: Weapons and Warriors
89099.description:
From the Publisher:

The master warrior doesn't simply snatch up his sword and hurl himself into battle. He adapts his tools to his goals, knows his weaknesses as well as his strengths, and leads his allies to victory. Low-Tech Companion 2: Weapons and Warriors expands on the already-encyclopedic information on TL0-4 warfare in GURPS Low-Tech, adding:


History. A concise rundown of how fighting evolved from the days of stone axes to the era of pike, shot, and cannon.
Weapon and Armor Design. Rules for customizing and resizing melee weapons, shields, and armor to suit almost any purpose.
Equipment Damage. Battles are hard on gear. Gamers after ultimate realism can track each item's state of repair down to the last Hit Point.
Fortresses. A look everything from hasty ditches to walled cities . . . along with huge cannon and giant siege towers for defeating them!
Transportation. Practical guidelines for getting infantry, cavalry, and naval forces from A to B.
Warships. Vehicle stats for early naval vessels, from penteconters to frigates.


Regardless of the scale of the fighting in your campaign, Low-Tech Companion 2: Weapons and Warriors brings you everything you need to put the violence in a broader context.

Low-Tech Companion 2: Weapons and Warriors is a supplement to GURPS Low-Tech. The information on the military history, siegecraft, and warships would be useful in any campaign that involves historically accurate warfare.

89100.name: Battle of Cannae
89100.description:
"Battle of Cannae" is the 3rd postcard wargame published by Formosa Force Game in 2011. It simulates the "Battle of Cannae" in 216BC.

Components:
Two players lead 11 Roman units and 7 Carthage units respectively. The battlefield is a 6X9 grids map. There are three kinds of soldiers including cavalry, heavy infantry, and light infantry.

Sequence of play:
Two players do actions alternatively. The Carthage player act first. He need to move all units and then units next to enemy units can attack. In each battle, two players roll 1D6 and add the unit combat value. The difference of the result determine which side needs to retreat or flip the counter. The cavalry unit can move for 3 grids and infantry can move for 1 grid.

Victory condition:
Player who eliminates half of opponent's army win the game immediately.

89101.name: Forgotten Futures XI: Planets of Peril
89101.description:
From the Publisher:

A complete setting for the Forgotten Futures RPG based on Stanley G. Weinbaum's acclaimed 1930s SF stories, including details of all nine worlds and the asteroids and major moons, spaceship operation and construction, weapons, romantic subplots, a detailed adventure campaign, three long adventures and eighteen adventure outlines, twelve ready-to-use characters, and much more.

89103.name: Artificers
89103.description:
Overview:
Players are skilled artificers trying to purchase the best components to make the most deadly gladiator weapon the world has ever seen. The game takes place in two rounds. In the first round the players compete in a shrewd auction to get the components they need. In the second round, the players build their weapons and battle to decide the winner.

Components:
1 pack of A-Type Nestoriles (60 tiles in 10 colors)

89104.name: Borderlands: Game of the Year Edition
89104.description:
Game Box

The Game of the Year Edition includes:

Borderlands Game
Tokens for All 4 Add-On Packs:
The Zombie Island of Doctor Ned
Mad Moxxi's Underdome Riot
The Secret Armory of General Knoxx
Claptrap's New Robot Revolution

Foldout Pandora Map

89105.name: Le Jeu du Labyrinthe
89105.description:
Easy abstract maze game. Every player start with 4 pawns in one of the four corners. On the board there are lying pieces (shaped like in Blokus).

On your turn you can do both of two actions in the order you like:
1. move one of your pawns as far as you like in an orthogonal direction, blocked by obstacles.
2. move 1 piece as far as you like in orthogonal direction.

The first player having 3 pawn on the nine center spaces wins.

89106.name: Sniper
89106.description:
Named after a dutch tv-series.

Every player gets a secret mission (winning condition). It is eleminating another player or taking over a part of the city. One piece of each player (the sniper) can be moved hidden. The rest is roll-and-move.

89107.name: DataMan
89107.description:
DataMan is an space themed educational game that comes with a "DataMan calculator", 12 cards and 4 dual sided boards. Each of the 12 cards are printed with sepecific instructions that explain how to set up the the "calculator" for differant games.
The four boards generaly feature a geometric play area as well as instructions for more complicated games.

The DataMan story is generally based around three characters: DataMan, Commander NumberFun and AntiMath. DataMan is a small robot designed by Commander NumberFun who is a ruler of a far away planet. AntiMath is an "Evil wizard from a dark star who has a mysterous power to cloud the minds of his victims and steal away the fun and excitement of mathematics."

89108.name: Triquetra
89108.description:
This game is played on a 12 x 12 field, with some squares colored and some grey. The players have 2 chieftains, 4 druids and 12 warriors each. Each type of pawn has its own movement rules. The goal is to reach the opponent's end zone with two chieftains or warriors.
The colored squares are either danger fields or trigger fields. If a pawn is on a danger field and the opposing player can move a pawn into the corresponding trigger field, the pawn on the danger field is destroyed.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

89110.name: The Familiar (Issue 1 - Dec 1994)
89110.description: First issue of The Familiar magazine. Marked as v2.1 on the cover and released for free.

89112.name: Fill in the "Bleep"
89112.description: Fill in the Bleep is the single answer card game that creates a thousand laughs. Players are dealt BLEEP cards and are presented a sentence with a missing word. Players then fill in the blank with their best BLEEP card based on the die roll, (Funniest, Quirkiest, Choice). The dealer will then Fill in the BLEEP with the best submission. But beware of action cards that can change the game in an instant. Be the first to get rid of all of your BLEEP cards and you WIN! Fill in the Bleep will bring brow raising, crazy, zany far out fun.

89113.name: Loaded Questions: Pop Culture
89113.description:
In this hilarious game where everyone's a critic, laugh, chat, and play away with 200 NEW creative questions on movies, music, television, celebrities, and all things pop culture.

Loaded Questions Pop Culture, just like the original and various versions, tests how well players know one another. It is the perfect game for anyone who loves movies, books or television. Questions include "If you ran a celebrity zoo, who would be your star attraction?" and "Which millionaire would you like to get a Christmas check from?" Matching people with their answers will score points for you. Loaded Questions Pop Culture comes with 200 new and hilarious questions that your family will love. You can play with enclosed components or the original game (original game sold separately)

89115.name: Miam
89115.description:
In Miam, players are merchants who are buying food stuffs at market, then selling them for cash, with more goods of the same type bringing a bigger payout. Whoever has the most money at the end of the game wins.

To set up the game, one player shuffles the 55-card deck – which consists of eleven categories of food (bread, pasta, cheese, etc.) with four cards in each category, four jokers, and seven special action cards – then spreads out the cards face down on the table. Each player starts with five money.

On a turn, a player uses special cards (optional), turns two cards face up, keeps one of these cards while flipping the other face down, sells sets of food cards (optional), and auctions cards on hand to other players (optional). The special cards, which are claimed like any other, allow a player to steal one card from an opponent or keep both cards revealed that turn. When a player sells a set of food cards, she receives 2-16 money for selling 2-5 cards of the same type; these cards are then removed from play. A player can auction any number of cards, with opponents bidding in round-robin fashion for the entire lot.

Once the last card has been claimed from the table, the game lasts three more rounds with players being able to take only the optional actions listed above: using special cards, selling sets, and auctioning cards.

89116.name: Robbit Mon Dieu
89116.description:
User Summary

An unofficial sequel to Jumping Flash! 1 and 2, this game sees Robbit take a break from saving the galaxy in order to perform household chores. Missions include gardening, catching frogs, and flipping fried eggs.

89117.name: Path of Exile

videogameexpansion.222987: Path of Exile - Sacrifice of the Vaal

videogamehonor.24529: 2013 Golden Geek Best Indie Video Game Nominee

89117.description:
Path of Exile is a free online-only action role-playing game set in the dark fantasy world of Wraeclast. It is under constant development by Grinding Gear Games in New Zealand.

* Completely free to download and play
* A persistent online world capable of supporting hundreds of thousands of players
* A dark and gritty game world rendered from a fixed 3D perspective
* Battle dozens of foes across a variety of unique areas
* Randomly generated levels and items for extreme replayability
* Online ranking and ladders for every game mode
* Visceral combat with dozens of combinable skills
* 7 different classes
* Endgame includes random maps that are item drops

Source: The Game Website.

89118.name: Act of War: Gold Edition
89118.description:
From the Publisher's Website

The critically acclaimed real-time strategy game Act of War: Direct Action takes you to future battle-fields all over of the world, putting you in direct command of huge armies of high-tech warriors and modern day weaponry.

With full-featured multiplayer and skirmish modes and a 33-mission single-player campaign, Act of War offers hundreds of hours of intense, realistic RTS gameplay!

The Act of War: High Treason expansion pack contains over 35 new units and upgrades, naval combat, mercenaries, expanded multiplayer options, a new single-player campaign, enhanced skirmish A.I., three new game modes, and much more!

89119.name: Battlefield 2: Booster Pack Collection
89119.description:
User Summary

A compilation pack of Battlefield 2 Booster Packs; Euro Force and Armored Fury.

89120.name: Crysis: Maximum Edition
89120.description:
From the Publisher's Website

Finally, gamers can get their hands on the entire Crysis world in Crysis Maximum Edition. The 2007 PC Game of the Year* is packaged along with the critically acclaimed parallel story, Crysis Warhead, and the explosive multiplayer combat of Crysis Wars. For newcomers to the Crysis world, Crysis Maximum Edition gives players chance to don the Nanosuit in three different games for one low price. Whether they’re saving mankind from an alien apocalypse or fighting alongside friends in online team instant action matches, there is something for everyone in Crysis Maximum Edition.

Microbadges:

Crysis Series fan

89121.name: Dragon Age: Ultimate Edition
89121.description:
User Summary
A compilation pack for Dragon Age: Origins which includes the expansion pack The Awakening as well as all the downloadable contents released for the game, including:

- The Stone Prisoner
- Warden's Keep
- Return to Ostagar
- The Darkspawn Chronicles
- Leliana's Song
- The Golems of Amgarrak
- Witch Hunt

89122.name: Empire: Total War & Napoleon – Total War – Game of the Year Edition
89122.description:
User Summary
A compilation pack for Empire: Total War and Napoleon: Total War, which also comes with all the downloadable contents.

89123.name: Romance of the Three Kingdoms V
89123.description:
User Summary:

Romance of the Three Kingdoms V is the 5th installation of the successful and still ongoing Romance of the Three Kingdoms series by Koei. It is the first edition to be based on the Windows platform.

Romance of the Three Kingdoms V is a multiplayer game, able to take up to 8 players. Players take on roles of a ruler/warlord and manage their respective territories. This includes recruiting officers, improving agriculture and economy, drafting and training armies, maintaining diplomatic relations with other rulers and waging war. The ultimate goal of the game is to reunify China.

There are two discerning features that depart from the past four editions:

i) Whilst the game is still turn based, the number of actions each ruler can take per turn/month now depends on the ruler’s reputation parameter. This depends on the ruler’s popularity with the peasants as well as the number of territories in the ruler’s kingdom.

ii) Army formations are introduced into the wars. Players get to choose the formations for each army deployed during wars. This can make quite a big difference to the outcome of the war as the effectiveness of each formation is dependent on the terrain the war is fought on.

89124.name: Evernight Figure Flats
89124.description:
Publisher blurb:

This awesome full-color file contains 135 figures with 35 different actual figures, including giant monsters like the stompers and of course all the character archetypes. That gives you almost every single character or creature listed in in the Evernight setting book for Savage Worlds!

89125.description:
Strange cycling board game because during the race the cyclists also switch to air movement (via either a balloon, slow or fast air plane) and travel over water (via a rowing boat, 2 normal boats and a hovercraft) between the tracks. The cyclist who arrives first in the port can choose which boat he chooses and thus move faster over the water to the final cyclist track. So this is a race game over land, air & water. The player who reaches the finish in Chiromo Village wins the game.

From the book The KnowHow Book of Action Games.
89125.name: Carrera Ciclista

89126.name: Super Hero Minis
89126.description:
Publisher blurb:

Here are 28 superhero/villain full color miniatures for your next supers game. Included are illustrated instructions on how to put them together. Note that two of them are duplicates of the same hero/villain at a different size (growth/shrinking powers).

89127.name: Il Grande Gioco del Giro d'Italia
89127.description: Very simple roll & move cycling game published in July 1973. It was based on the Tour of Italy, on the board you start in Belgium , travel through Germany & Switzerland with the final and largest part of the race in Italy. The game comes with four cardboard riders and two dice.

89128.description:
French self-produced cycling game that features a couple of two-faced boards whith which you can make four different tracks, four teams of four riders (some of them hand painted, though monochrome), an extra yellow jersey rider (to replace the leader in stage races), a set of tactic/chance cards, a couple of dice, some markers, a classification sheet and a set of rules.

On your turn you divide your dice throw among the riders, maximum four points per rider; you cannot win the race unles all your riders have reached a certain 'hot' point in the race; you have to play inmediately chance cards but you can keep tactic cards (you take a card for each rider that finishes his move in red fields).

Strange is that the riders also have to pass barriers and gates. The game is played over several stages. In each stage points can be scored depending on your result in that stage. After all stages have been completed the total from all stages is added up to determine the winner.
89128.name: Cyclo Tour

89129.name: Sins of a Solar Empire: Trinity
89129.description:
User Summary
The complete collection for the Sins of the Empire which includes the micro-expansion packs, Entrenchment and Diplomacy.

89130.name: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War II – Gold Edition
89130.description:
User Summary

Compilation of Dawn of War II and it's stand-alone expansion, Chaos Rising.

89131.name: Warhammer: Mark of Chaos – Gold Edition
89131.description:
User Summary
Compilation pack for Mark of Chaos and its expansion pack Battle March.

89133.name: Millipede

videogameversion.139222: Android (Atari Greatest Hits Arcade Emulation) edition

89133.description:
Millipede is a 1982 arcade game by Atari, Inc. and is the sequel to the arcade hit, Centipede. The objective of the game is to score as many points as possible by destroying all segments of the millipede as it moves toward the bottom of the screen, as well as destroying and avoiding other enemies. The game is played with a trackball and a single fire button, which can be held down for rapid-fire. The game is over when the player's last life is lost.

Source: Wikipedia, "Millipede (arcade game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89134.name: Street Slam
89134.description:
User Summary

Street Hoop is a basketball game developed by Data East originally as an arcade title. The game features 10 teams representing different countries (or US cities in the North American versions), and allows players to compete in head-to-head matches of 3-on-3 basketball.

Each team was ranked in four characteristics: Dunks, 3pts, Speed, and Defense. Every team had 18 stat points spread over the four categories. During gameplay in the arcade version, if the player lost the first half of the game they would need to use a continue to play the second half.

Street Hoop set itself apart from other basketball games by its unique “Super Dunk” meter. When the meter was filled, players would be able to jump 30 feet into the air and dunk the ball. In addition, every shot made with a full meter would go in.

89136.name: Super Real Darwin
89136.description:
User Summary

SRD: Super Real Darwin is a vertical scrolling shooter developed by Data East. The game is based in the future on the planet Lakya. The Lakyans unwittingly release the planetary lifeforce which is harnessed by the inhabitants of the nearby planet of Cokyo. The Cokyoans use the lifeforce to create biomechanical ships that they use to invade Lakya. The Lakyans develop their own biomechanical ships to defend their planet.

The player controls one of these Lakyan ships as they fly through levels defeating the invasion forces. There are a number of different pickups that will make the ship more effective in combat, including armor, speed, and attack upgrades.

A unique feature of SRD is the Evol pickup. These icons will transform the ship into another, stronger form. These transformations would last for a minute before they expired unless the player collected another Evol icon, in which case the ship would upgrade to an even more powerful form.

89137.name: Wizard Fire
89137.description:
User Summary

Wizard Fire is an arcade title developed by Data East and the direct sequel to Gate of Doom. The game is set in a fantasy world in the IV Century AD. An evil wizard plans to take 101 lives to open the Dragon Shrine, and it falls to the Shining Knights of the Wizard Fire to thwart his machinations.

Wizard Fire is an RPG style beat ‘em up, with hordes of enemies attacking the players in every level. Players can either quest solo or as a two person team, and there are five characters to choose from – the Knight, Wizard, Bard, Dwarf, and Elf. Each character has unique strengths and weaknesses that differentiate it from the others.

Levels are shown isometrically, and characters are able to attack in 8 directions. Players cannot attack and move at the same time, however. Many stages are capped with boss fights, and treasure chests litter the maps. The chests contain artefacts that upgrade a character’s stats and abilities.

89138.name: Data East Arcade Classics
89138.description:
User Summary

Data East Arcade Classics is a compilation title that brings together 15 classic arcade games that were developed by the now defunct company Data East. Many of the games are listed under their original Japanese names. Arcade Classics includes a number of features unavailable on the original games, such as allowing players to link high scores to their Mii. In addition, a number of goals have been added to the games which provide an extra challenge.

89140.name: Beyond Atlantis
89140.description:
Atlantis II (Known as Beyond Atlantis in North America) is a fantasy adventure computer game developed by Cryo Interactive and published by Dreamcatcher Interactive, and released in 1999. It's a sequel to Atlantis: The Lost Tales. However, unlike its precursor, not much of the game is based around Atlantis. It was followed by Atlantis III: The New World.

Setting

In this adventure game, take Ten, the Bearer of Light, through his journey to Shambhala to confront the Bearer of Dark so that balance can be returned to the Universe. To find Shambhala, he must gather the pieces that make up the "road to Shambhala" from different locations and time periods - China, Ireland and the Yucatán.

The game features a "point and click" interface, full 3D panning, puzzles of varied difficulty, conversations with other characters, and a fully-orchestrated musical score.

Source: Wikipedia, "Beyond Atlantis", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89141.name: Game for Cats
89141.description:
User Summary

Game for Cats is the world's best video game (for cats) not humans!

Play in two modes: 1) Chase a laser! and 2) Chase a mouse!

Game for Cats will randomly set the laser or the mouse (depending on the selected mode) on a random path, requiring no effort on your own part. Once a cat paws at the laser (or mouse), the iPad's touch-sensitive screen will detect the input and the mouse (or laser) will dart out of the way. WOW!

Every pad of the target racks up more points. Endless hours of excitement such as this enables even the laziest of cat owners to play with their beloved feline... without lifting a finger!

Use two iPads for the ultimate in multiplayer competition—see which cat can earn the most points! Or even play to see which cat loses interest in the moving images on your iPad soonest. Know a crazy cat collector? Play in teams! The more cats playing Game for Cats on iPads, the better!

89142.name: e-Pig Rope
89142.description:
Join an exciting and e-Pic journey! From Chile! e-Pig Rope! A New Concept In Games! A Original Rope Game! With Retina Display! If your device can have retina display. his is the second e-pig Game! (Search for e-pig) Action, Adventure and SPEED! A very Adrenaline and addictive game! This game is very EXTREME.
