Help Eddie To Explore the Jungle! But Beware of Monsters and Spikes! You Will have to use your rope to go throw the jungle. Use your e-PiC Skills to beat the Angry Eagle on the Final Level! You Will Feel like a Ninja! Ninja`s Like to use Ropes. So.. Unlock Red and Black Ninja and Beat the Evil Eagle in This E-PIC Challenge. Discover the Secret Level! Is a Hard One! Learn to Play while you progress in the Game!

Features:
Retina Display
Custom Made and AWESOME graphics.
Custom Made and AWESOME music.
Your Loved Character! Eddie!
Unlock Characters.
Secret Levels.
Save your progress.
15 Levels, in Difficulty Order, from Easier to Harder.
First Levels, are tutorial.
Compete with your friends for High Score!

Join an exciting and e-Pic journey!

Source: The Developer Website.

89143.name: Tiki Toss 3D
89143.description:
Kick back and relax, watch the surf, enjoy the music. It's time for some Tiki Toss 3D!

Gameplay is simple and fun! Swipe to swing the ring and hook a ringer on the tiki board! Tiki Toss puts you in an immersive beachside scene complete with tons of details from perfect surf and chirping seabirds to a full tiki bar and fresh island music!

This relaxing beachside game is a digital rendition of the classic island hook-and-ring game. Complete with 3D graphics, the addictive game-play provides a ton of fun, while tempting your competitive nature. With score sharing and 3 different gameplay modes you can check out global leaderboards whether you're Amateur or Pro. You can even earn score multipliers and "double down" on your current score in Arcade mode! Best experienced with headphones, Tiki Toss 3D features full length tracks by popular island artists and sound effects that keep the player engaged.

Visually striking scenery, cheering friends and the calming rumble of breaking surf combine to offer an element of escape while enjoying casual gaming competition.

Get ready to mellow out and spend the day soaking up the sun, beachside. Let Tiki Toss 3D transport you to the islands today!

IMMERSIVE 3D ATMOSPHERE
Combines striking scenery, cheering friends and the relaxing rumble of breaking surf, and even a tiki bar.

FUN ANIMATIONS
True-to-live swing and rope animations, rolling waves, surfing and a gentile island breeze

3 GAMEPLAY MODES
Best of Ten: See how many ringers you can score out of 10 tosses.
Session: No toss limit so try to get a run of ringers.
Arcade: Earn extra tosses, score multipliers, and even bet all your points on a single toss if you're feeling skillful!

NEW AND POPULAR MUSIC
Features awesome full length reggae and bossa tracks with available in-app purchase links

SKILL BUILIDING
Go Pro for the ultra-realisic game

Source: The Developer Website.

89144.name: Nanoids
89144.description:
Dragged across the universe by a sinister fate, the Petralites must now confront the avatars of death. Destiny, it seems, favors a new breed, a ruthless unfeeling technology bent on the extinction of mankind.

Nanoids is a fast-paced action-packed shooter that is sure to satisfy even the most hardcore of gamers. You have been tasked with eliminating the Nanoid threat and saving the lives of millions on your home world Petra, in your galaxy, and beyond.

Main Features:

Upgradable ship and weapons
Dozens of unique enemies to fight
Huge challenging bosses
Overworld map with many missions to choose from and multiple paths to the final mission
Overall progress and stats automatically saved, plus movable in-mission save points
Unlockable content with three game modes in total
Extensive use of multi-touch interface with onscreen gamepad, right and left handed controls, and individual item touch
Local and global high scores allow you to compete alone or with the rest of the world
Suspend a game in progress and return at anytime, exactly where you left off
Awesome built-in music tracks and sound effects
Listen to your own music while playing if you prefer

Source: The Game Website.

89145.name: Fallout 3 – Anchorage and The Pitt

videogamecompilation.154163: Fallout 3: Game of the Year Edition

89145.description:
User Summary

Add on pack for Fallout 3 which includes the DLCs Operation: Anchorage and The Pitt.

89146.name: Sir Lovalot
89146.description:
Reach a new height in jumping games with Sir Lovalot and the Infinite Tower! Tilt your device to jump around the tower in full 3D and get Sir Lovalot to climb without harm, rising ever further in search of love.

Source: The Developer Website.

89147.name: Corncob 3D

videogamecompilation.148817: The Home Entertainment Shareware Collection: Vol. 6: Simulation Shareware Games

89147.description:
The Pie in the Sky engine's fairly popular predecessor game. Instead of being a first person shooter like the later games based on Pie in the Sky it is a flight simulator game. The game takes place in a world where Hitler died in childhood and World War II never happened. It its stead, aliens have invaded the Earth. The player must take control of a F4U Corsair, the only World War II plane that made it into this alternate history, and defeat the alien invaders. The game takes place in a variety of different locations and was noted for its original gameplay and presentaton. It is also known for being one of the few shareware flight simulators.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pie in the Sky (game engine)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89148.name: Lethal Tender
89148.description:
Secret agent Nick Hunter must thwart the evil Thorne Devereaux, who is planting bombs in U.S. currency. The game featured various singular features such as taking the uniforms of dead enemies for protection. The game is described by Home of the Underdogs as a "a fun, albeit amateurish, first-person shooter." The game set out the style followed closely by most other Pie in the Sky engine games, particularly noting its inventory system, though even its graphics were mostly reused by later games as well. The game is also known as Legal Tender.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pie in the Sky (game engine)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89150.name: Working Backwards!
89150.description:
User Summary

A compilation of four recently released titles.

89151.name: Red Babe
89151.description:
Red Babe was one of the first games to use the Pie in the Sky engine that was not made by the engine creators themselves, being made by The DaRK CaVErN Productions. The game features the player's quest to save the beautiful Sharla, the titular "Red Babe" due to her penchant for a red dress.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pie in the Sky (game engine)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89152.name: Invader
89152.description:
User Summary

In The Invader you control a giant mech, which you will use to kill and destroy countless of enemy soldiers and machines. You will attempt to enslave mankind, and destroy the various human rebels. But you mustn't fire all of your guns at once, as your gun has a tendency to overheat, rendering you defeseless for a while.

89153.name: Fly Control
89153.description:
Air traffic control has never been so animated. Control the flies to their stinky targets and see what happens if you cannot avoid the encounter.
Why land planes or dock boats when you can fly? Aircraft have two wings but only these can fight for fuel. Their fuel is food.
Be the lord of the flies! Be the dictator of all flies!
Get your buzz on!

Incredibly simple but amazingly addictive! With the intuitive controls and fun gameplay you'll take to this game like flies to...

FEATURES
- OpenFeint support
- 4 leaderboards (3 for each level and a total score leaderboard)
- 21 achievements
- Facebook / Twitter support
- synchronizing player statistics online and on the device (you can
take your stats with your account to another device)
- sarcastic humor
- crude fly fights
- various playfields
- domestic and horse flies
- insects as temporary food
- beautiful animation
- funny sound effects

Source: The Developer Website.

89154.name: High School Musical: Sing It!
89154.description:
High School Musical: Sing It! is a video game based on the popular 2006 television movie High School Musical and its 2007 sequel High School Musical 2 for the Wii and PlayStation 2.

Troy, Gabriella, Chad, Taylor, Ryan, and Sharpay are available to the player or they can create their own character. The visuals of the game are animated and based on motion-capture.
Source: Wikipedia, "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_School_Musical:_Sing_It!]," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89155.name: Kamikaze Race
89155.description:
User Summary

In Kamikaze Race you control a car racing down the freeway. The brakes are broken and the accelerator is stuck. You must dodge the cars, in order to survive as long as possible. How long can you survive?

89156.name: Saving Gaia
89156.description:
This app, Saving Gaia, aims to educate the masses about climate change through interactive and engaging puzzle gaming. Although most people already have a fair bit of idea about climate change, it is still quite hard for any individual to put into practice the things that can improve the environment. Looking at an advertisement or billboard about saving the planet have very little influence on the minds of people unlike the mental involvement and level of awareness achieved when we play games. You will be surprised by the impact this game can bring through the subtle messages about recycling & energy conservation that pop up on the game console.


Win attractive cash/voucher prizes with our latest version.
Challenge mode for players to challenge one another in forming the largest avalanche.


Features:

9 kind of Saving Gaia bricks, including bricks for industrial, clean energy, mining, recycling & trash.
Compete scores with friends through Openfeint.
10 proprietary & attractive game backdrops taken from around the world shown as game progresses.
Nice music & sound effects.
Each new game starts with 3 bombs to help clear bricks.




How to play

Harvest bricks to earn points.
Star bricks are used to harvest bricks of same colour.
Harvesting red or yellow bricks earns more points but damages Gaia.
Harvesting blue or green bricks earns less points but improves Gaia.
Game ends when Gaia hits zero or bricks over-fill the board.




Our initiative aims to spread the awareness of climate change through educational & engaging iphone gaming. Be a part of this initiative by downloading & playing this game.

Source: The Developer Website.

89157.name: Big Brain Wolf
89157.description:
Big Brain Wolf is a downloadable 2D point-and-click adventure game for puzzle lovers. This crime story takes place in a fairy tale kingdom inhabited by a vegetarian, asthmatic wolf, a bipolar Genie, a chubby Red Riding Hood, a long-nosed lawyer, and a slew of hilarious characters. To clear his mother of the murder charges brought upon her, our lupine friend will have to train his brain through 60 puzzles and riddles.

Source: The Developer Website.

89158.name: AlterEgo (Issue 4)
89158.description:
Contents
2 Var hälsade, kära läsare! Editorial
3 Speak now or be forever silent? Letters from readers
4 Fantasyintriger Ideas and intrigues for fantasy adventures
8 Recensioner Reviews
10 Hjälten An expansion on the Hjälte (Hero) concept from Drakar och Demoner
15 Trollkarlens Torn Adventure setting for Drakar och Demoner
18 Fashion 99 Speculating on trends in RPGs the coming year

89160.name: Moody
89160.description:
Be the player who's secret mission card is closest to the mood marker after the character reaches the mood wheel.

Each player is a daemon that guides and influences the main character. The game is a struggle between daemons to control main character's spiritual state or his mood by using the environment surrounding the character. Daemons take turns playing cards to trigger the environment or some of it's aspects to shift the character's mood, advance the character to next section or to change the environment all together. Each player's actions directly affect decisions and strategy of the other players. Game ends when the main character jumps into the mood wheel.

89161.name: AlterEgo (Issue 5)
89161.description:
Contents
1 Ledare Editorial
2 Drakar och Demoners utveckling genom åren The history of Drakar och Demoner
14 Gravplundraren Short story
15 En vanlig dag Short story
16 Odyssé genom seriefansinens subkultur About comics fanzines
18 NisseNytt som det kulturella avantgardet About the fanzine NisseNytt

89162.name: AlterEgo (Issue 6)
89162.description:
Contents
2 Stoppa momsen på rollspel! Editorial
3 Slöjd + Lajv = Lajvhantverksläger Handicraft in LARP
4 Om de förskräckliga stenstodsfallen Adventure for Castle Falkenstein
9 Recensioner Reviews

89163.name: AlterEgo (Issue 7)
89163.description:
Contents
2 Förlåt! Editorial
3 Kobold Review of a new fanzine
4 En plats i solen Free form RPG in SciFi setting'

89164.name: AlterEgo (Issue 8)
89164.description:
Contents
2 I’m a nörd - and proud of it! Editorial
3 Castout On the unpublished RPG Castout (Outcast)
4 Ont och Gott i rollspelslitteraturen Good and evil in RPG-litterature
7 Surkärringen skränar Cuaserie on kobolds and others with the wrong approach to RPGs
8 Sånger från Cornekk Adventure

User comment
The games system for Cornekk isn't specified. But it is likely intended to be played with Eon

89165.name: Clay 'n' Rain
89165.description:
In a world made of clay, only one person stands between the sky, the flowers and total mayhem. The plants and flowers of Clay World need rain to survive, and only you can bring it to them. Using the power of your iPhone’s tilt mechanism, guide thousands of clay raindrops onto hundreds of clay flowers over dozens of clay levels.

The innovate gameplay of Clay n’ Rain makes full use of your iPhone’s tilt mechanism to deliver relaxing gameplay into the palm of your hand. Raindrops, even clay ones, are simple little things and can’t always find their way to the ground when there are lots of obstacles in the way. So it’s up to you to help guide them on their way from sky to flower.

Original graphics and a colourful cuteness that will put a smile on the faces of players of all ages, and all exclusively for your iPhone!


Game assets completely made of clay,
100 kg of clay used to create the game!,
44 unique levels, 4 unique worlds (Village, Forest, Castle, Royal gardens),
Innovative gameplay,
Two gameplay modes (Casual, Hardcore)


Source: The Developer Website.

89166.name: Incubation Mission Pack: The Wilderness Missions
89166.description:
From Publisher's page

Includes new Weapons, new levels, new enemies and a map editor.

The Mission CD for the award winning turn-based strategy game "Incubation: Time Is Running Out".

When something goes horribly wrong during a recovery mission on the planet Scayra, you’re left stranded with only a few of your men and no means to radio for help. Driven by desperation, you flee the now familiar city and wander off into the mysterious jungle. What you discover there will shock you and push your tactical skills to the limit.

39 terrifying missions will take you through 3 new unforgiving worlds. Battle new varieties of bloodthirsty Scay’Ger with an expanded selection of deadly weapons. Create your own fiendishly clever worlds with the professional style level editor!

Challenge other squads in 10 specially designed multi-player levels or team up with friends against the Scay’Ger in the new cooperative mode. Buy your copy of "Incubation: The Wilderness Missions" and prepare for new tactical challenges that will turn your darkest nightmares into merciless realities.

89168.name: Hlifsteinn
89168.description:
From publisher blurb:

Complete Characters #1 - Hlifsteinn, Barbarian Witch-Hunter

Barbarian chief, elder, and holy warrior, the wise and aged Hlifsteinn leads devoted men from every clan in an eternal fight against their enemy, The Demon, and the witches that his evil sows among the people of the North Country. Suitable for any fantasy or medieval setting, this inaugural Complete Character brings elements of a sophisticated, but primitive culture to your gaming table, and opens the door to the possibilities of epic battle against an immortal evil that must be stopped.

89169.name: Helot
89169.description:
From publisher blurb:

Complete Characters #2 - Helot, Human Vigilante in a Supers World

Tired of watching the whole of humanity go soft under the protection of superpowered humans, Todd James takes on the guise of Helot to wage his personal war against the capes, both good and evil. His daring and willingness to fly in the face of the "rules" of superhuman engagements are his greatest weapons. The perfect anti-hero, villain, or even hero of any campaign world where Supers and normal humans coexist.

89170.name: Brandy
89170.description:
From publisher blurb:

Complete Characters #3 - Brandy, Earthbound Sea Nymph

Today, Brandy is a barmaid at a favorite seaside pub, but her simple life hides a dark secret. She is actually a Sea Nymph, forever cursed to a mortal life by a crime of passion. Her life and existence is a great mystery waiting to be discovered by a group of player characters in a fantasy, horror, or any type of adventure setting.

89171.name: Corporal Jake Avery
89171.description:
From publisher blurb:

Complete Characters #4 - Corporal Jake Avery, Haunted Police Officer

Officers of the law see their fair share of unforgettable atrocities, but sometimes they stumble into places that none of us were ever meant to be. When Corporal Jake Avery saw his partner murdered by something he couldn't understand, it shook his life in such a way that he never fully recovered. This module includes stats and adventure ideas for using Corporal Avery in your campaign, stats on the mysterious Dark Beast, and more. Perfect for your urban fantasy, horror, noir, or mystery campaign.

89172.name: Lisonnel Arma
89172.description:
From publisher blurb:

Complete Characters #5 - Lisonnel Arma, Temptress and Criminal Mastermind

The beautiful, but unusually warm and affable she-elf known to most simply as Liz leads an amazing double life. To the world she is the star attraction at The Dancing Bird, a tavern popular with the local underworld. In secret, she bankrolls and controls most of the criminal activity in a large portion of the city. In this module you'll learn all about this criminal mastermind, her proxy, and her methods. Also find information on a bonus character, and plenty of adventure hooks for your fantasy campaign.

89173.name: Noriax
89173.description:
From publisher blurb:

Complete Characters #6 - Noriax, Ancient Robotic Terror

An ancient race was once locked in a war for its survival. Its greatest weapon, a massive robotic drone known as Noriax, was left behind and has now been activated, unleashing its indiscriminate, unstoppable force against the whole of the known galaxy. Get full stats, custom illustration, and source material on Noriax, plus adventure hooks and details on its path of destruction so far. As a bonus, get full stats and description of the ancient Eirie, the ancient race that created Noriax.

89174.name: Sir Aric Devilkin
89174.description:
From publisher blurb:

Complete Characters #7 - Sir Aric Devilkin, Evil Knight, Demon's Son

Sir Aric Devilkin and his dark attendants have been searching the country for some unknown treasure for the past two years, laying waste to town after town along the way. He does nothing to deny the whispers that he's the son of a demon, and his cruelty only enforces it. Within this premium RPG module you'll find the complete description of Sir Aric, his immediate history, and his nefarious methods, plus stats on his minions, rumors of items of power, and tons of optional tweaks and adventure hooks. Perfect for your fantasy campaign, and suitable for quick adaptation to any game system.

89175.name: Seldr the Starseer
89175.description:
From publisher blurb:

Complete Characters #8 - Seldr the Starseer, Astrologer and Soothsayer

Fortunes, ruins, fates, and doom are all written in the stars. Learn about the legendary wise man, Seldr the Starseer, and his pursuit of the knowledge that is to be had by studying the stars. His uncanny accuracy has made him the favored counsel of princes and scoundrels and fortune seekers, alike. He plays no games and has no allegiances, except to the truth as written on the night sky. A great resource for the player characters in any fantasy campaign, and suitable for quick adaptation to any game system. This edition of Complete Characters is so full of adventure ideas and optional Tweaks that it extends to an unprecedented FIVE pages. As a special bonus, this character includes quick-and-dirty dice-rolling mechanics for soothsaying, usable with any system.

89176.name: Action Jack Allen
89176.description:
From publisher blurb:

Complete Characters #9 - Action Jack Allen, Pulp Supersoldier

One an average, blue-collar civilian with a knack for getting into trouble, Jack Allen stumbled into a larger world of intrigue and espionage. Now, when someone utters the secret words, Jack Allen transforms into Action Jack, super-soldier! Live his adventures as he foils fascist conspiracies and collaborations in the thrilling world of pre-WWII pulp action-adventure. Includes Tweaks, adventure hooks, and notes on eight additional super-soldiers for use in your pulp, action, superhero, or WWII campaign.

89177.name: 17 Magic Armors
89177.description:
From publisher blurb:

17 Magic Armors is a new book for your d20 fantasy world. Within these pages you will find never before seen magical prefixes to add to your armors. Each magic armor enchantment comes with a Maket Cost and Creation Cost.

89178.name: Operation Thunderbolt
89178.description:
User Summary

Operation Thunderbolt is a sequel to the rail shooter Operation Wolf. A plane has been hijacked by terrorists and landed in Kalubya, Africa. Roy Adams is once again called to the rescue. His mission: free the hostages and destroy the terrorists.

Like Operation Wolf, Operation Thunderbolt is a rail shooter. This time there are 8 different stages instead of 6, and the game includes a coop mode so two players can play on the same screen. The game has two different endings, depending on how many hostages were rescued and if the pilot is rescued in the last mission.

89179.name: 17 Magic Cloaks
89179.description:
From publisher blurb:

You know what would make you look COOL? A nice magical Cloak. Think about it... while your party members are dying left and right, your bright warm magical cloak is there to keep you alive. Don't have one you say? Well fortunately The Le Games is here to help with 17 Magic Cloaks!

Here are 17 cloaks to make your teammates drool. Each magic cloak comes with creation cost and market value, making this book useful for players and GMs alike.

89180.name: 17 Magic Gloves
89180.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of the same old gloves? Well, how about a nice set of magic gloves? That's right, The Le Games is here to help you out with our new book, 17 Magic Gloves. Inside you will find 18 fantastic magical gloves, which can be used in any d20 campaign.

89181.name: 17 Magic Weapons
89181.description:
From publisher blurb:

17 Magic Weapons is a new book for your d20 fantasy world. Within these pages you will find never before seen magical prefixes to add to your weapons. Each magic weapon enchantment comes with a Maket Cost and Creation Costs.

89182.name: 17 Necromancer Spells
89182.description:
From publisher blurb:

17 Necromancer Spells is a new book for your d20 fantasy world, and is aimed squarely at... well, the Necromancer.

89183.description:
From the product description:

Colonial Battlefleet: Man vs. Machine is the first fleet book supplement for the Colonial Battlefleet tactical starship combat core rules. This supplement provides new rules and options to tailor your Colonial Battlefleet game to a new setting. In this setting artificially intelligent machines have succeeded in wiping out all human life on the planet Earth. The machine intelligence now seeks to do the same to offworld human colonies that have been out of touch with Earth for millennia.
89183.name: Colonial Battlefleet: Man vs. Machine

89184.description:
Fantasy Flight Games is pleased to announce the upcoming release of The Chaos Moon, the second Battle Pack installment of The Morrslieb Cycle! This 60 card pack contains 20 different never-before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Warhammer: Invasion metagame.

In The Chaos Moon, the Dwarf brewer Josef Bugman brings his legendary ale to the hold, while the High Elves deliver the wrath of the massive Moon Dragon and the Empire’s wizards control the very forces of nature. Meanwhile, Papa Nurgle inflicts a horrific new disease upon the Old World, frenzying Witch Elves bathe themselves in blood, and the Orcs bash everything in sight!

And all the while, the enigmatic Wood Elves watch from the forests...
89184.name: Warhammer: Invasion – The Chaos Moon

89186.name: G.M. Magazine (Issue 19 - Mar 1990)

rpgissue.4032: G.M. - The Independent Fantasy Roleplaying Magazine

89186.description:
The Last issue of the magazine

Contents:

•News
•Michael Moorcock Interview
•Reviews
•Historical Alternatives: The great Mutiny by Jon Sutherland & Nigel Gross
•Living History - The Southern Medieval Society
•GM as a Character Class by Nathan Evans
•LRP in the USA by Mark Matthews-Simmons & Margo Toth
•Terminator by Nigel Streeter
•PBM Update by Wayne
•Competition: Win Last Ship Home
•Books by Alan Crump
•Q and A
•Convention Corner
•Comics by Philip Morton
•Comic Strip: For King & Country
•Clubs
•The Axeman Cometh!
•Critical Hits by David Langford

89187.name: 17 Paladin Spells
89187.description:
From publisher blurb:

17 Paladin Spells is a book for your d20 fantasy world, and is aimed squarely at the Paladin.

It never made sense to us that the Paladin had to use the same spells as the other spellcasters. Well, 17 Paladin Spells is going to fix it.

89188.name: 17 Ranger Spells
89188.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's not fair that the Ranger has to share their spells with those other pesky core classes. The Le Games is here to correct this grave injustice with 17 Ranger Spells.

89189.name: 17 Relics
89189.description:
From publisher blurb:

17 Relics is the latest book in our "17" series, and this one is going to knock your socks off. It starts out with a page of mini quests that you and your party can partake, then leads to the mysterious Relics themselves!

89190.description:
Initiations of the Favored is the third Asylum Pack in the Rituals of the Order cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. This cycle introduces new Monsters, Servitors, Rituals, and Items, as well as cards for the Order of the Silver Twilight. The story of Lucy Jennings, Silver Twilight initiate, continues in the serial tale by Jeff Tidball.

Initiations of the Favored is a fixed 60 card Asylum Pack that contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.
89190.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Initiations of the Favored Asylum Pack

40270.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game

boardgamefamily.10579: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game (LCG)

89191.name: Forgotten Weapons: Stonebow
89191.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Stonebow. An ancient weapon designed to work much like a crossbow, but using stones as it's primary ammunition. This new series from The Le Games and Chaos Drake Press takes a look at this fascinating weapon and gives you all of it's glorious d20 stats for use in your campaign world. Inside you will find everything you need to know about the Stonebow, Repeating Stonebow, and the Stonebow Sworn (prestige class). But wait, there's more. Also included are brand new feats and new spells, to better balance out this marvelous weapon.

89192.name: ZODIAC Final Fantasy RPG
89192.description:
From the official website:

ZODIAC is a pencil-and-paper RPG designed to capture the feel of SquareSoft's series of video game RPGs known as Final Fantasy. The ZODIAC rulebook is available online or in downloadable PDF format, and are 100% free for anyone to use.

89193.name: SRD Illustrated: Core Classes
89193.description:
User summary:

A compilation of the D20 Fantasy SRD core classes with artwork.

89194.name: Neo Clerics: The Opus Priest
89194.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Opus Priest is a clerical path devoted to one god, the Patron of Works. Where regular clerics may have varying philosophies and religions, Opus Priests dedicate themselves simply to a life of hard work and good deeds. They are granted no spells and no domains, but receive occasional boons from their deity to aid them along their way. The rest is up to their own strength and willingness to overcome.

Opus Priests dedicate themselves to showing others how to live life without magic; to rely on the old ways and survive using mundane means. Powerful Opus Priests work to become the bane of dragons, liches, magic item crafters, spellcasters and even magic-abusing adventuring groups.

This file contains a full 20-level Priest class, right at your fingertips!

89195.name: Journey to Extinction Island
89195.description:
User summary:

This game is part of the Gone Extinct Groovy Tube Book published by innovativeKids. It consists of a hardcover book, a tube of plastic animals, and a game board in the attached box. The book describes various extinct animals, including the plastic animals it comes with, and the game rules are on the last couple pages of the book.

Journey to Extinction Island is a roll-and-move game that has 2-4 players traveling several small paths to collect specimens from each zone (Water, Flyers, Forest and Swamp), while avoiding poachers. The first player to collect one of each type and make it through the final zone (the poacher camp) wins the game.

89196.name: Neo Druids: The Savage Heart
89196.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Animals are perhaps the greatest creations of Nature. Rather than passively fitting into their ecosystem like plants, or mindlessly following their biological programming the way insects do, animals are able to learn, adapt, and thrive. Animals, more than any other aspect of the natural world, embody the principles of nature itself. For these reasons, some druids find animals more worth of reverence than other aspects of nature. For these druids, the Savage Hearts, Nature itself is still to be worshipped and venerated, but the best way to do so is to emulate its greatest creations."

Time to spice up your world with Neo Druids: The Savage Heart, a new druid class from The Le Games. Each of its 20-levels comes with a special ability, making this the most dangerous druid you've ever seen! Aspect of Wolf, Savage Spear, Sonic Spear, Procupine Cloak -- this is just a small sample of the powers you will unleash with the Savage Heart!

89197.name: Planeta Barça
89197.description:
A Trivial-like game on all facts and history about the soccer team Futbol Club Barcelona, 'Barça'. As in Trivial Pursuit, players advance along the board tracks by correctly answering questions. The first player gathering six trophies will be the winner.

Questions come in six different categories:
- History
- Players, coaches and presidents
- Trivia
- Matches and biography
- Images
- Non-soccer teams

Game components:
- 1 gameboard
- 6 tokens
- 1 die
- 298 question cards, with more than 2,500 questions
- 2 cards
- 36 trophies
- Rulebook

89198.name: Neo Fighters: The Fire Knight
89198.description:
From publisher blurb:

"As a knight who has learned to master his inner soul and project it through his sword, the Fire Knight is a master of battle who cuts down his foes with his fiery blade and his blazing abilities. They are found in the front lines of battle due to their combat prowess and generally fiery natures. While not as hearty as a traditional fighter, the Fire Knight can hold his own, and his wide array of abilities is welcome to any adventuring party."

Tired of the same old Fighter? Want to spice things up? Well we're here to help with Neo Fighters: The Fire Knight! This new fighter class is focused on fire and is welcome to any adventuring party.

Inside this fantastic book you will find the Fire Knight, a full 20-level class right at your fingertips!

89199.name: Neo Paladins: The Martyr
89199.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are many different kinds of Paladins throughout the land, including the mystical Martyr. Armed with the faith of a child, and the healing touch of the gods, the Martyr is welcome in any adventuring party.

Inside Neo Paladins: The Martyr, you will find a full 20-level Paladin class at your fingertips. Written by James Spahn, this new class is going to make you say 'wow'!

89200.name: Inspector Gadget's Mad Dash
89200.description:
Play as Inspector Gadget as you run, jump, swing, and fly to try and save Penny from Dr. Claw. Look out for the traps though, and get ready to have fun in this endless side-scrolling adventure!

Source: The Developer Website.

89201.name: Transformice
89201.description:
User Summary
Transformice is a free multi-player 2D platform game in which each player controls a mouse who must get a piece of cheese and bring it to his mouse hole. Although it features classic platform action usually there isn't a continuous path through which mice can obtain cheese and go back so, in each level, one or two mice are turned into shamans who can summon several kinds of objects like planks, boxes and anvils to help the other mice reach their destination. First players to get in the hole with the cheese earn bonuses but trying to rush in not only can get you killed, in some levels you can even make it impossible for the rest of the players in the room to get the cheese.

89202.name: The Incident
89202.description:
Run and jump your way to safety as an angry rain of just about everything in the world falls and builds a mountain of platforms for you to climb up, up… up to the source of it all: the cause of The Incident.

Source: The Developer Website.

89203.name: Divine
89203.description:
Divine is a game for 2 to 4 players in which you assume the role of a Deity trying to spread their religion in ancient times. You can use your divine powers to quickly gain followers or deviously attack your competing religions. Priests, Zealots, Prophets, and Avatars are your pawns of strategic influence in a developing city which you must control.

The game board consists of 9 tiles that are randomly placed at the beginning of the game to represent an ancient city. Each tile consists of a 36 square grid that depicts various special locations within the city. Players start by controlling a single temple that allows them to train either Priests or Zealots. Priests can preach to gain followers based on the population of each spot on the game board; however, they are vulnerable to be assassinated by an opponent's Zealot. Priests can also establish new temples throughout the city, which can also be desecrated and destroyed by an opponent's Zealot. Unit movement is dictated by multiple dice rolls equal to the number of temples you control.

Players can use divinity cards from their hand to change the outcome of certain scenarios. More powerful units like Prophets and Avatars can only be created by using specific divinity cards. By taking control of special spaces on the board players can also receive additional bonuses.

To win the game players must carefully choose a win condition to work towards. A player wins the game if they are the first to 1) amass 100 follower tokens or 2) capture all 4 tower spaces or 3) be the only remaining player with a temple.

89204.name: Annals of Rome

videogamehonor.29118: 1987/1988 Golden Joystick Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee

89204.description:
Annals of Rome begins in 273 BC with the player in control of the Roman state. Unlike other war-strategy games, the aim is not military victory but survival for the longest time possible. In the initial few hundred years, the player will be at war with Carthago, Greece, Gauls.... If any of these ancient powers are conquered and annexed, they will continue to rebel until the time of historical death for that state (for Macedonia this is 146 BC). They will then be succeeded by a new power which will also try to destroy the Roman state. In this way Carthago will be followed by the Numidians, and the Parthians with Persians ... The player will always face 13 active states/nations under computer control.

Source: Wikipedia, "Annals of rome", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89205.name: Apollo 18: Mission to the Moon
89205.description:
User Summary

Apollo 18 simulates a fictional mission to the Moon in the early 1980's, following on from the last real flight (Apollo 17) before NASA cancelled the program.
The game is split into a number of sequences reflecting the various stages of an Apollo mission.

89206.name: Das Boot: German U-Boat Simulation
89206.description:
User Summary

Das Boot (literally 'The Boat') simulates controlling a Type VII U-Boat for the Nazis, in an recreation of submarine warfare circa 1941.

89207.name: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War II – Retribution

videogamehonor.29996: 2012 D.I.C.E. Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee

89207.description:
Dawn Of War II: Retribution is the second stand-alone expansion to the Dawn Of War II series. The single player campaign will be playable for races other than the Space Marines. As of October 2010, the Orks and the Tyranids have been announced as playable races in single-player. It will also reintroduce base building to some degree. An additional playable race will be included, but has not yet been announced.

Source: Wikipedia, "Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War II – Retribution", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89209.name: Mytran Wars
89209.description:
It's the 23rd century: The earth's natural resources are virtually exhausted and the ruling multinational conglomerates are searching for new raw material deposits in space in order to avert the impending catastrophe.

Mytran Wars is a sci-fi turn-based strategy game exclusive to the PSP® system.

Source: The Publisher Website.

89210.name: HTPsim
89210.description: Simulation of a cycling race. It is possible to play a simulation of a stage race with multiple stages. Typically the length of a stage will vary between 150 and 200 spaces. Movement in the game is determined by the position of the riders in the peloton. A peloton typically consists of 10 teams with each 3 riders.

89211.description: French board game about indoor cycling, it comes with 3 dice and a board with a metal frame. It is unknown when this game was produced.
89211.name: Le Petit Vélodrome

89214.name: Falcon 4.0: Allied Force
89214.description:
Allied Force is an upgrade (as well as a partial remake) of Falcon 4.0, fixing many bugs that made an otherwise amazing simulator, unplayable. Allied Force includes all the original contents such as the dynamic campaign set in the Korean peninsula, plus it also includes an all new Balkans theatre.

User Summary

89215.name: Rouleur
89215.description: Cycling game where the goal is to advance riders depending on the dice rolls (there also is one black die) and on the use of energy cards. There are 5 cyclists numbered from 1 to 5. Each team has one control board where pins can be sticked in. The game is also played with a deck of 200 energy cards, there are 5 different energy cards.

89217.name: Keirin
89217.description:
This game is a simulation of a Keirin indoor track cycling race although it can in theory be played with multiple players who can place bets on the outcome of the race. Keirin is a sport where the riders are following a derny (a motorcycle) before they are released in their race. The game is played with 6 riders and 6 different colours and a derny, multiple coloured dice and a track of 60 squares long.

In 2012, Anki added a Print and Play update. The main differences are:

a) There are 9 racers now, like real in keirin races, instead of six. However, for a shorter game, you can drop some riders (the ones with the highest numbers). Playing with 6, 7 or 8 riders is ok.

b) You do not need a lot of different coloured dice. You just need as many dice as racers, that is, nine dice.

c) The motorbike now takes part in the game, even if it's just in the first turn. It is not there "just for the ambiance" anymore. The rule foir the first throw of rider 1 has also changed.

89218.name: Mayhem in Monsterland
89218.description:
Mayhem in Monsterland, released in 1993, was a game produced for the Commodore 64 home computer. Its titular hero, "Mayhem", was a yellow triceratops blessed with the gift of speed. His goal was to return his world from sad to happy, ridding the world of monsters along the way. The game featured effects not previously thought possible on eight-bit computers, and was the first C64 title to have a real feeling of speed, a "console-esque" feature the developers wanted.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mayhem In Monsterland", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89219.name: Alex Kidd: The Lost Stars
89219.description:
Alex Kidd: The Lost Stars (アレックスキッド ザ・ロストスターズ?) is a platform arcade game released by Sega in 1986. It was ported to the Sega Master System in 1988. It is also released on the Wii Virtual Console in North America on March 9, 2009[1] and in the PAL regions on April 17, 2009.

Alex Kidd: The Lost Stars features Alex Kidd and Stella searching for the twelve Zodiac signs.

Alex Kidd: The Lost Stars uses recycled stages, making the player go through all the stages again with increased difficulty, with bonuses in different positions.

The arcade and Master System versions are similar, aside from graphics and sound. The arcade version has a limited number of lives (three by default), whereas the Master System version has infinite lives, though being hit or falling into a pit subtracts seconds in the timer and backtracks the player to the last checkpoint in the round. The arcade version features a cooperative two player mode, with the second player assuming the control of a female counterpart to Alex Kidd named Stella.

Source: Wikipedia, "Alex Kidd: The Lost Stars", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89220.name: Ultra Quick Soccer
89220.description:
The scope of Ultra Quick Soccer is much like the other games in the Ultra Quick lineup. With UQ Soccer, I aim to provide you with an extremely quick and accurate method of resolving the final score between two soccer teams. With UQ Soccer you can play out an entire season for a team or a league in rapid fashion. UQ Soccer makes a perfect stand-alone game for season replays. It also functions very well as a complimentary game by resolving the games that don’t particularly interest you in a detailed shot-by-shot game, while you use the detailed game to play out the games that do interest you.
Unlike most quick play games, which only provide a team score, UQ Soccer does offer an optional individual scoring module to allow you to track league leaders in goals and assists in leagues that track the stat. There is also an individual goal keeper option for some seasons which will allow you to track goal keeper Wins and Losses as well as GAA.

89221.name: Boggin'
89221.description:
Experience all of the drama and excitement of professional Mud Bog Racing with Boggin'.

Boggin' includes 21 of the best Modified trucks from all over the world.

Boggin' simulates every facet of the sport from mechanical failures to full runs.

Mud bogging, also known as mud racing, is a form of off-road motor sport popular in the United States in which the goal is to drive a vehicle through a pit of mud of a set length. Winners are determined by the distance traveled through the pit or, if several vehicles are able to travel the entire length, the time taken to traverse the pit. Typically, vehicles competing in mud bogs are four-wheel drives.

There are many types of mud bogs. From Hill and Hole, Flat or Progressive Track, and Open Bog. They come in many shapes and sizes from 150 feet to over 300 feet. Hill and Hole is just as it sounds, usually is 60 feet wide 200 feet long and is a series of hills and holes, and make challenging to each truck. Progressive tracks are generally flat with the consistency of the mud varying as the vehicle advances through the pit.

Boggin' features 24 of the best mud bogs in the world. And each is uniquely rated for length, type and difficulty.

You need not be an expert or even a full-fledged fan of mud bogging to enjoy the game. Everything needed to "bring you up to speed" is included in the rule book. Even those with no knowledge of the sport itself will love this racing game.

89222.description:
The once quiet small town of Blackwood has become a battleground. A coven of vampires has crept in under the cover of darkness to drain the very life from its helpless citizens. As powerful as these creatures of legend are, they do not prowl the streets unchallenged. A team of skilled vampire hunters with an arsenal of modern weapons has tracked these bloodsuckers down and the battle for the soul of Blackwood is about to begin.

Play as either vampire or hunter, using Attack cards to battle for the citizens of Blackwood, Impact cards to enhance your powers, and deadly Strike cards to destroy your opponent. Unleash powerful combos and use Blood or Adrenaline as you fight, alone or with a teammate, through both night and day. Win battles to recruit the innocent bystanders at the Nightclub, Church, Graveyard, Police Station, and Hospital. Claim the most locations to win control of the town.

Save the town of Blackwood, or drain it dry.
The choice is yours.


Bloodsuckers is a highly thematic strategy card game for 2 to 4 players ages 13 and up.

- Players can choose to fight as either vampires or hunters with different abilities for each side.

- Time of day is tracked using the Clockdial with day and night having special effects on gameplay.

- Multiple ways to combine cards gives players exciting strategic options.

- Four-player games focus on unique team-based gameplay.
89222.name: Bloodsuckers

89223.description:
From the back cover
“ Cranston Snord's Irregulars have widely different reputations, depending on who you ask. Katrina Steiner thinks of the unit as one of the most effective, if unorthodox, units in her employ. House Marik would like to rid the Inner Sphere of the unit and has been trying for many years. Jaime Wolf sees the unit as a band of looters who have made good. One way or the other, the Irregulars are probably best known for their ability to get into and out of tight spots created by their never-ending quest for the lost artifacts and/or treasures of Mankind's past. Whether called looters or not, they are still a unit to be reckoned with.

This scenario set details the history of Snord's Irregulars, profiles the statistics and conditions of it members and the company 'Mechs, and includes 14 scenarios pitting the Irregulars against the wide variety of opponents they have fought throughout their colorful past. Also described are some of their more memorable treasure hunting expeditions.”
89223.name: BattleTech: Cranston Snord's Irregulars

89224.description:
From the back of the book:

"The mercenary company McKinnon's Raiders was nicknamed "The Fox's Teeth" for their long and successful history in carrying out the policies of Hanse "The Fox" Davion. Now considered a house unit of the House of Davion, the most powerful of the Successor States, McKinnon's Raiders has a remarkable history of loyalty under the most trying of circumstances.

This scenario set details the history of McKinnon's Raiders, profiles the statistics and condition of the members of the company and includes 14 scenarios pitting the Raiders against the wide variety of opponents they have fought throughout their colorful past."
89224.name: The Fox's Teeth: Exploits of McKinnon's Raiders

91673.name: BattleTech: More Tales Of The Black Widow

89225.description:
rom the back of the book:

"This supplement is packed with descriptions of one of BattleTech's most elite fighting companies: The Black Widow Company of Wolf's Dragoons. Selling their services to the highest bidder, this mercenary unit is well known throughout the Successor States. Included is a history of the Black Widow Company and her commander, Natasha Kerensky, details of the units that make up the company and the MechWarriors who do the fighting, plus 15 scenarios of actual engagements fought by the Black Widow."
89225.name: Tales of the Black Widow Company

89226.description: Italian cycling game from just after WWII about the Tour of Italy. It uses roll & move mechanics but technically it's not a race game because the winner is not the player who reaches the final square on the board first but the player scored the most of points on the track.
89226.name: Giro Ciclistico d'Italia

89227.name: Galahad and the Holy Grail
89227.description:
User Summary
A derivative of Atari's "Adventure" programmed by Douglas Crockford, this simple game puts you in the role of Sir Galahad of King Arthur fame. You move from 2-d top-down area to area collecting items and fighting bad guys (you go into sword battle mode when an enemy like the Black Knight is near).

89228.name: Bicross
89228.description: This French cycling game for children was given as a bonus in april 1986 with the French Picsou magazine. It was the third and last of their cycling series (the other two being Picsoutour and Pic-Etape). This time we have a free-style race. The best thing of this one is that the track is three-dimensional. As can be expected, landing on downhill squares is better than landing on uphill ones!

89229.name: 6 day Bike Race
89229.description: This game is unique because it's a self destructing game! The game was published with six paper boards that self destruct after you play the game! It has a cycling theme, the mechanic is that you have to touch with a burning cigarette the starting line of the cyclist, the line of the rider that's burned up first is the rider that wins the game.

89230.name: Radrennen
89230.description:
German cycling game that features 4 double sided board with multiple tracks for road cycling, track cycling and time trial. It's a dice game but it doesn't use regular dice. Instead it provides 6 different-coloured modified D6s.

Teams are composed of 5 riders (6 teams provided, plus some riders with special jerseys: rainbow, yellow, pink, green and polka-dot (the last one is the jersey for the German national champion).

There are rules for one day races and for stage races, including rules for time trials, team time trials, and even the prologue, as well as rules for 11 different track races!

89231.description:
From the back cover,

"The Homeworld of the Arachnid menace has been located and the Mobile Infantry has been moved into position to strike -- are you ready to join the greatest battle Mankind has ever initiated?

Klendathu Invasion is the largest combined fleet and Mobile Infantry operation of the Arachnid War to date.

Within these covers:

Invasion: The story of Starship Troopers continues, from intitial preparations for invasion to the final retreat.

Army Lists: The Mobile Infantry gains the use of the huge invasion companies, while the Arachnids fight back with cunning traps and tunnel systems.

Fighting on Klendathu: Determine the fate of your own Mobile Infantry company during the invasion in a complete campaign."
89231.name: Klendathu Invasion

89232.description:
From the back cover,

"Bugs. Arachnids. Call them what you will, they are the greatest and most terrifying threat Mankind has ever faced. A species so utterly ruthless and alien that they are beyond comprehension. The Arachnid Army Book takes this most compelling threat and reveals a level of detail never before seein inprint."

The Arachnid Army Book provides detailed background, new rules and new unit types for Bug forces in the Starship Troopers miniature game.
89232.name: Arachnid Army Book

89233.name: Tron: Solar Sailer
89233.description:
From Box

Your opponent is the tireless Master Control Program! The Solar Sailer will be attacked relentlessly on its way to the MCP center and the decoding phase. In both phases, you'll hear VOICES -instructing, even taunting you to give your all!

89234.name: Cry Havoc! (Issue 1)
89234.description:
In this volume:

•News

89235.description:

89236.name: Cry Havoc! (Issue 4)

rpgissuearticle.139300: Battle Report: The Tears of Yllia protects on of its sancturaries from the Griffins

89236.description:
In this volume:

89237.description:

rpgissuearticle.139514: Battle Report: The Gorge of the Dragon

89239.name: Cry Havoc! (Issue 7)
89239.description:

89240.name: Cry Havoc! (Issue 8)
89240.description:
In this volume:

•Rackham Color
Discover the colors of your armies!
Learn to paint the orcs of the Behemoth
•Dogs of War
Choosing the right troops for your free company
Army-by-army tips and examples
•Titan
Tarascus: Characteristics and capacities
•Rag'Narok
Rag'Narok versions of the new abilities in Confrontation 3
•Aarklash
Secrets of the Army of the Beast
The Sessairs
Cadwallon: The Usurers
•5 Exclusive Cards

89241.name: Zigurat
89241.description:
For millennia, two clans have held the balance of power in the Zigurat. Now, the day of the rebellion has come and the two sides face to conquer the pyramid. Each clan has priests and colossal guardians to carry out the mission.
The first to crown the top of the Zigurat will rule over everything.

Zigurat is an abstract game for 2 players, which will have to move their Priests and Guardians by a three-dimensional board representing a Mesopotamic ziggurat.

Durante milenios, dos clanes han mantenido el equilibrio de poder en el Zigurat. Ahora, ha llegado el día de la rebelión y los dos bandos se enfrentan para conquistar la pirámide. Cada clan cuenta con sacerdotes y colosales guardianes para llevar a cabo la misión. El primero que consiga coronar la cima del Zigurat dominará sobre todo.

Zigurat es un juego abstracto para 2 jugadores, los cuales tendrán que mover a sus Sacerdotes y Guardianes por un tablero tridimensional que representa un zigurat.

89242.name: Operation Flashpoint: Red River
89242.description:
The game's plot will concern a fictional conflict in 2013 Tajikistan. When a civil war breaks out, the US Marines Corps move in to deal with it. However, the People's Liberation Army, of neighbouring China, become suspicious. When they order the Marines to leave, they refuse, and the world's next flashpoint erupts.

Source: Wikipedia, "Operation Flashpoint: Red River," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89243.description:
From the back cover,

"The Army Book: Creatures of Dirz is a supplement for Confrontation: The AGe of Rag'Narok. It contains everything you need to playwith or battle against the alchemical laboratories of the Scorpion."
89243.name: Confrontation: Creatures of Dirz Army Book

30991.name: Confrontation: The Age of the Rag'Narok

89244.description:
From the back cover,

"The Army Book: Wolfen is a supplement for Confrontation: the Age of Rag'narok. It contains everything you need to play with or battle against the sedentary packs (Wolf)"
89244.name: Confrontation: Wolfen Army Book

30991.name: Confrontation: The Age of the Rag'Narok

89245.name: Who Gets the Cheese?
89245.description:
Feeling particularly confident in his speed one day, a mouse brought a challenge to his unlikely friend, a kitty. The mouse would attempt to capture as many pieces of the cheese placed throughout the house as he could without being caught. However, if the kitty manages to catch him, he'll have to give up one of his six shiny trinkets for the kitty to wear. Let the competition begin!

Game Play:
Play starts with the first player turning over the top card of his face-down Draw Pile and placing the card face up in the center of the table. This card starts the Play Pile for the game. The type of card that is played will determine the sequence of actions that takes place next. As soon as all 6 Kitty Pawns are awarded, the game ends. Each player then counts up his or her combined cards and Kitty Pawns. The player with the most combined cards and Kitty Pawns is the winner!

89246.name: Synergy Artifacts
89246.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to the world of Synergy Artifacts. In this book you will find many handy artifact items that you will be able to plop down into any campaign you may be running -- 76 items to be exact.

So what is an artifact, and what is a Synergy Artifact? Artifacts are usually described as extremely powerful items. Rather than merely another form of magic equipment, they are the sorts of legendary relics that whole campaigns can be based on. The traditional artifact has always had very high power levels and almost always been for use by high-level characters only.

Thus, there is the problem. Artifacts are one of the most interesting game mechanics in the d20 system and everyone loves them, but why do you have to be level 10 before ever getting one? This is where Synergy Artifacts come in.

Synergy Artifacts are designed to be available for low-level characters. As the character gains levels in his/her classes, the Synergy Artifact item becomes more powerful. Furthermore, Synergy Artifacts comes in sets. When a character uses multiple items from the same Synergy Artifact set, the items grant additional powers and abilities.

89247.name: Treasures of Malevolent Magic
89247.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever wanted to try out Malevolent magic items? Ever wanted to create your own? We're here to help with Treasures of Malevolent Magic.

This dark book delves into 31 Malevolent Magic Items, 2 Artifacts, and 2 Artifact Sets (10 set items total).

89248.name: Unorthodox Barbarians
89248.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you like to beat things up with a good club?

Well we have just the thing for you: UNORTHODOX BARBARIANS! This 25 page pdf contains 5 New Barbarians for you to use in any d20 fantasy world. Each Barbarian comes with a detailed background, new abilities, and new progression charts. "Cure Critcal wounds" is only for those who don't know how to cause critical wounds.

Written by Robert J. Grady (and fantastic cover by Tom Miskey), this book details the following five new Barbarians:

The Conquerer: Defense is for sissies.
The Corsair: Barbarians are found in the sea as much as on land
The Planar Marauder: They search the different planes in search for treasure.
The Savage Screamer: Scream. Because you know you will die.
The Wild Rider: On horseback, they know no equal.

89249.name: Unorthodox Bards
89249.description:
From publisher blurb:

For years the Bard has been that core class that no one wants to play. Limited spell casting abilities, terrible fighting capabilities, and a list of Bardic songs that even Paula Abdule would not like. Time to change it all with our new book: UNORTHODOX BARDS!

This 45 page pdf contains 5 New Bard classes for you to use in any d20 fantasy world. Each Class comes as a full 20-level write-up that will give you a new respect for the Bard (each one comes with a detailed background, new abilities, and new progression charts). That's not all though -- included in this book are 2 new Bard Prestige Classes, and over a dozen artifacts for your d20 fantasy campaign. Cover your ears Simon Cowell, because these Bards are going to take you for a wild ride!

This book details contains the following:

The Minstrel - With their Enchanted Instrument in hand, they can create over a dozen spell-like effects with just a song. This is in addition to their normal Bardic Music!
The Skald - With their magical abilities at hand, they can inscribe runes onto objects and people for different magical effects.
The Soothsayer - Fortunetellers, tarot readers, and diviners -- the Soothsayer is known by a number of names.
The Spellsinger - Many sages theorize that the true language of magic is music. Certain races such as the elves also believe in the link and have used the power of music for centuries in their most potent magic. A few very talented musicians have dedicated their lives to studying the link between music and magic -- the Spellsinger is such an individual.
The Troubad’war - A Troubad’war is the ultimate contradiction to himself, often referring to himself as a lover and a fighter. While some Troubad’wars fight for the purity of love or to prove their worth to a damsel they are eager to impress, there are those that have also loved and lost. These Troubad’wars know there is a dark side to love and use their abilities to gain vengeance against whatever has caused them to lose their loves, or maybe they are just itching for a good fight.
The Muse (Prestige class) - The Muse is a Bard who specializes in enhancing the abilities in others, for good or bad. He does this through his Bardic Music, with songs passed down by the Bards of old. The Muse’s greatest strength is the ability to Inspire others; but unlike the common Bard, the Muse’s music is far more potent.
The Protectorate (Prestige class) - The Protectorate is a Bard who specializes in aiding his allies in time of need. He does this by learning powerful Bardic Songs that have been passed down from the heavens.
Baubles and Urus of Ancient Power (Artifacts) - 15 artifact items that can be infused into your existing items for devestating effects!
Johansson’s Song (Artifacts) - This artifact set consists of an Amulet, Cape, and Ring. Each one has fantastic powers, but as the set becomes more complete, the wearer gains even more powers. But the true powers and abilities only surface if the wearer is a Bard!

89250.name: Unorthodox Clerics
89250.description:
From publisher blurb:

Question: Do you love d20 and do you love Clerics?
Question: Do you want a cleric that gives you a little extra something?

Maybe we have what your looking for in our new product: UNORTHODOX CLERICS! This 25 page pdf contains 5 New Clerics for you to use in any d20 fantasy world. Each Cleric comes with a detailed background, new abilities, and some new progression charts that will make you say ?yowza yowza yowza?.

This book details the following five new Clerics:

The Chosen: Warrior priests dedicated to the works of their god.
The Cultist: They are liars, cheaters, and fanatics. (Maybe we should have called them "politicians")
The Elementalist: They walk a delicate balance between the four elements, maintaining a precious balance that could consume them if they loose control.
The Inquisitor: NO ONE EXPECTS THE INQUISITOR
The Priest: They walk the path of enlightenment, but is able to fight undead better than their standard cleric counterpart.

89251.name: Unorthodox Druids
89251.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pop Quiz: You love Druids and want to play one in your D20 campaign, but you don't like the Druid that comes in your handbook. What do you do? What do you do?

Let The Le Games help you solve this dilemma with UNORTHODOX DRUIDS! This 20 page pdf contains 5 New druids for you to use in any d20 fantasy world. Each druid comes with a detailed background and new abilities that will make you say ?wow?.

This book details the following five new Druids:

The Caller: A fierce druid that lives by animal instincts.
The Enforcer: A mystical druid living harmoniously with nature.
The Shaman: A spiritual druid that is often misunderstood.
The Survivalist: A druid who specializes in surviving the harsh wilderness.
The Tree Warden: A Druid who lives and dies by the soul of the tree.

89252.name: Unorthodox Fighters
89252.description:
From publisher blurb:

There's a Dragon before you, with evils eyes and sharp gnashing teeth. What do you do? What do you do? (you could always try to fire a magic missile, you wuss).

For those of you who like to get in close an personal with bad things, UNORTHODOX FIGHTERS is for you! This 25 page pdf contains 5 New Fighters for you to use in any d20 fantasy world. Each Fighter comes with a detailed background, new abilities, and new progression charts. MAGIC MISSILE? You don't need no stinkin' Magic Missile.

This book details the following five new Fighters:

The Bastion: The ultimate living roadblock.
The Bully: Bows and Arrows? Not for the Bully -- a good rock makes a better impact sound.
The Dogfighter: Down on his luck, the Dogfighter depends on himself and his only trustworthy companions
The Legend Seeker: When he walks into the room, everyone speaks his name. If they don't, then they must be mute or dead.
The Second Son: Middle Child Syndrome can be tough. The Second Son struggles to impress his parents even though they just don't care.

89253.name: Unorthodox Knights
89253.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unorthodox Knights is a new 45-page pdf book for any d20 fantasy world. Within this book you will find six (yes we said six) new full 20-level core classes, one prestige classes, and a dozen Baubles & Urus (mini artifacts)!

Each core class comes with a full flavor description and new class abilities that will make you say "whoa". This book contains the following:

Battle Knight - Do I really need to describe this one?
Chevalier Amour - Is he a lover or a fighter?
Knights of Frost - Cold is good.
Knight of the Road - The road is long and dark, but to the Knight it is a friend.
Knights of the Broken Tusk - Love playing an Orc? Then the Broken Tusk is for you!
Lanternian Knights - In brightest day, in darkest... oops. These Knights spend their lives attoning for a past wrong.
The Blind Blade (prestige class)
Baubles & Urus of Ancient Power (Artifacts)

89254.name: Honey Comb
89254.description:
Save the Bee

This game plays like "Don't Break the Ice", but it's vertically oriented. Players take turns spinning a spinner determine which color 'block' they are going to knock out of the honeycomb, which destabilizes the whole setup. The first person to drop the bee sitting on top of the honeycomb loses.

89255.name: Atomic Driver

videogameversion.77700: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition

89255.description:
User Summary

Atomic driver is an exploration and shooting game, with puzzle elements. The player drives a car armed with a laser and must explore cities in top-down view. Hazards include other cars, monsters (only some of which are destructible) and road blocks. Key elements of the gameplay is mastering the player's laser reflections (a shot hitting a flat surface is deflected at a right angle), and figuring out the movement pattern of the enemy cars and monsters. Several power-ups can help, freezing enemies for several seconds or destroying them.

The player has only one life, any hit on the car and the game is over.

89257.name: 3D-Sub
89257.description:
User Summary

3D-Sub is a light submarine simulation. Players command a sub and must destroy as many other submarines as possible, pick up their microchips and bring them back to a chest hidden in a cliff.

The player can control the bearing and speed of her ship. The sonar displays the sea bank, and the radar displays enemies and the location of the chest. Enemies are destroyed by firing torpedoes at them with the nose of the submarine facing the right direction.

89258.name: Unorthodox Monks
89258.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pop Quiz: Is your d20 monk everything you want it to be?

Let The Le Games help you answer this question with UNORTHODOX Monks! This 20 page pdf contains 5 New Monks for you to use in any d20 fantasy world. Each Monk comes with a detailed background and new abilities that will make you say "hubba hubba."

This book details the following five new Monks:

The Chaos Monk: Monks aren't always lawful, and they aren't always nice
The Lasserator: Unarmed attacks are for sissies.
The Shadow Warrior: A monk best described as a mix between a monk and a rogue.
The Snake Master: When the snake strikes, beware.
The Spiritual Defender: Paladins can't have all the fun. Evil Beware.

89260.name: Unorthodox Pirates
89260.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever wanted to be a pirate? The Le Games is here to help with your latest book, Unorthodox Pirates! Inside this fantastic book you will find six new pirate classes with full flavor descriptions and stats for a full 20-levels. That's not all! This product also includes Pirate familiars, twelve Pirate themed magic items, gun rules for your fantasy campaign, and a pirate theme song from our friends at Bailey records!

The core classes in this book includes:

Freebooter: The Freebooter is the quintessential pirate. Freebooters are excellent sailors, trained from their youth in the art of living, surviving and fighting at sea. Not even the scurvy dogs that make up the civilized navies can out-climb a Freebooter in the rigging, and no man alive can best them in melee while standing on a slippery, pitching ship's deck. Freebooters are the people that society has forgotten or cast away because their race, class, or conduct was seen as unsuitable.
Ghostly Buccaneer: They say in whispers at dockside taverns and on the late watches of the seafarers that dead men tell no tales. They speak of deals that desperate sailors have made with the evils spirits deep within the blackness of the ocean depths. Most sane watermen dismiss these as mere legend and hearsay, but a few of the more grizzled and wary sailors know the truth.
Privateer: Some men and women are simply born to lead, and their natural charisma almost always carries them to positions of power. Privateers are the pirate equivalent of these people. A Privateer usually captains their own ship and crew, and possesses a letter of marquee that acts as a kind of diplomatic immunity, giving official sanction to their raiding and plundering. Privateers embody many different leadership styles - some lead from the front, while others are content to let lackeys do all the work - but they all share a common obsession with reputation and fame.
Ravager: The Ravager is the kind of pirate that other pirates fear. Whenever there is murder and slaughter to be done, the Ravager always takes his work a little too far - and enjoys it a little too much. Ravagers are the classic landlubber's idea of a pirate: fierce, horrible, bloodthirsty savages. They have no need for mercy, fine words, or logical reasoning, and they enjoy nothing more than wading into battle with a sword in each hand and another clenched between their teeth.
Swashbuckler: Some pirates live only to kill, rape, plunder and drink themseles stupid. Swashbucklers look down on these scurvy dogs; for a Swashbuckler, it's all about style. This type of pirate knows that it's not what you do, it's how well you do it. Theirs is the sword-whirling, chandelier-swinging, over-the-top school of combat, and they never pass up an opportunity to show off their skills or spin a tale of their latest daring escape. When a swashbuckler enters the room, he or she commands attention - especially from the opposite sex.
Wavelord: The Wavelord is at one with the ocean. He is a living conduit for the power and magic of the sea, a kind of nautical druid. Old sea dogs whisper that, "Whenever a child is born at sea and the mother cannot keep it, it is tossed overboard to be claimed by the waves. Years later a Wavelord will emerge - a man with saltwater for blood, who can make the currents change at his command." So say the old-timers (to anyone who will listen).




And much much more.

89261.name: Unorthodox Ranged Combatants
89261.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dragons, Barbarians, and Giants -- what do they have in common? Well, my first answer would be stay far far away! What's the best way to accomplish that? Become a Ranged Combatant, of course!

Unorthodox Ranged Combatants is a new 50-page pdf book for any d20 fantasy world. Within this book you will find 5 new full 20-level core classes, 2 prestige classes, and over 20 Baubles & Urus (mini artifacts)! Each core class comes with a full flavor description and new class abilities that will make you say "wubba wubba". Still not sure? Then check out the free demo!

This book details the following:

The Demolitionist' - Able to craft black powder, the Demolitionist uses this new material to craft large explosives and small "grenades" to use against his enemies.
The Improviser - Jackie Chan isn't the only one who can use a mundane item to his advantage.
The Leviathan Slayer - With the ability to Monster Smite, the Leviathan Slayer is formidable against all his foes, and even moreso against monstrous ones.
The Pistolier - Ever wanted to take a gun into a sword fight?
The Wandslinger - Swords and magic are good, but duel-wands are better.
The Divine Archer (prestige class) - Arcane Archers are for sissies.
The Pinpointer (prestige Class) - Called shots are the way to go for this class.

89262.name: Unorthodox Rangers
89262.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pop Quiz: You love Rangers and you love D20, but you don't like the Ranger Class that comes with your handbook. What do you do? What do you do?

Let The Le Games help you solve this dilemma with UNORTHODOX RANGERS! This 20 page pdf contains 5 New Rangers for you to use in any d20 fantasy world. Each Ranger comes with a detailed background and new abilities that will make you say "yeah baby."

This book details the following five new Rangers:

The Beast Master: A fierce Ranger who specializes in unarmed combat.
The Hunter: A Ranger who is best described as a Ranged Combatant.
The Outdoorsman: A Ranger whose strength is outdoors.
The Partisan: A Ranger who is most dangerous when the odds are against him.
The Trapper: A Ranger focuses on subduing his enemies rather than killing them.

89263.name: Unorthodox Rogues
89263.description:
From publisher blurb:

After years of dungeon crawling and decades of role playing, there has been one consistent character in every one of your parties: The Rogue. But the Rogue hasn't changed much over the years... he's still a sneaking, hiding, backstabbing... well, you get the point. Maybe it's time to spice things up with UNORTHODOX ROGUES!

This 60 page pdf contains 5 New Rogue core classes and 3 new prestige classes for you to use in any d20 fantasy world. Each core Class comes as a full 20-level write-up that will make you love the Rogue, or hate him even more (each new core Rogue class comes with a detailed background, new abilities, and new progression charts). That's not all -- included in this book are over a two dozen artifacts for your d20 fantasy campaign. Bring on the traps, because your new Rogue can handle it all!

This book details contains the following:

The Fabricator - This engineer knows no equal. He can construct taps on a moments notice, or disassemble them in the blink of an eye.
The Layabout - Everyone has a friend like this, even if they wish they didn't. Lazy, sneeky, sly, and fast talking. Watch your purse.
The Seductress - With a wink and a kiss, the Seductress is a master of... well, seduction.
The Shroud - This sly character has learned to use the dead as way to gain riches.
The Skulker - A master assasin.
The Backstabber (prestige class) - With great pride the Backstabber has learned to survive with his dagger alone.
The Saintly Thief (prestige Class) - A Rogue that steals from the rich and gives to the poor? How... unorthodox.
The Ward Boss (prestige Class) - Every gang needs a boss.

89264.name: Red Nova
89264.description:
Red Nova Episode 1: First Contact, the game at release, is an inertial survival shooter for iPhone, iPod Touch and iPad. Future episodes will be released as free updates to the game and will comprise different game modes and missions.

While on a routine mission to test a number of prototype fighters destined to replace the Earth Colonial Fleet's aging Starhawk, the ECS Red Nova, your carrier, comes across an unknown alien fleet preparing to stage a sneak attack on the human colonies!

In order to give the Red Nova a chance to escape and warn the rest of the fleet you have volunteered to attack the aliens head-on. With a choice of any of the fighters on deck, you have to use your wits, your guns, and your ample supply of homing missiles to survive for as long as you can!

Source: The Developer Website.

89265.name: Viking Lords
89265.description:
User Summary

A clone of BattleLore. The English attempt to stave off a Viking invasion on a hex-grid battlefield. 15 maps, 18 unique units, both single-player (AI) and hot-seat 2-player modes.

89266.name: Minigore
89266.description:
Minigore is a game for the iOS developed by Mountain Sheep and published by Chillingo. The lead character, John Gore, is voiced by Arin Hanson. It has also been announced for PSP minis.

Players control the games main character John Gore in a 3D world called 'Hardland'. They must defend John from creatures called furries attacking him by shooting them using John's gun. Collecting 3 clovers will turn John into a Giant Ox enabling him to destroy furries by running into them for a limited amount of time. The game is over when John dies after he has been hit three times. There are points awarded for furries killed. There are OpenFeint leaderboard and achievement capabilities.

Source: Wikipedia, "Minigore", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89267.name: Bonsai Blast
89267.description:
Experience the Zen of gaming nirvana! Featuring addictive puzzle game play, intuitive touch screen controls, and a beautiful "Zen garden" theme to deliver 90 levels of match 3 marble-blasting bliss. Advanced features include using walls to ricochet marbles, chutes to guide marbles down winding paths, and swapping shooter locations with a single touch.

Source: The Game Website.

89268.name: Glyder
89268.description:
Eryn has been sucked into a dimensional rift and is left in a world that is not her own. Take control of her glider and help her explore the magical surroundings. Soar over the majestic and peaceful Rift Valley. Take death-defying flights through the Dark Pinnacle. Unearth the Lost Kingdom. Explore the wonders of Ambrosia. Discover the secret that lies above The Mushrooms, and delve into the Hidden Depths. Perform fun gliding maneuvers like power dives and dolphining and harness thermals to soar high into the sky. Collect crystals, take trips, earn achievements, and help Eryn unlock a portal home.

Source: The Game Website.

89269.name: Deer Hunter 3D
89269.description:
Welcome to the most realistic hunting simulation game on mobile. Set your sights on deer, moose, bears and more with true-to-life senses and behaviors. Hunt in scenic 3D environments around the world featuring changing seasons and weather conditions. Unlock new weapons, skills, and hunts by bagging the biggest kills.

Source: The Game Website.

89270.name: Family Feud (Mobile)
89270.description:
Name a game show that everyone loves to play? The Family Feud! The original user-generated content game show comes to mobile in its authentic form! Now you will be able to experience the game everyone knows and loves. Go up against other families in the Face-Off and Fast-Money rounds to answer fun and entertaining questions based on surveys of 100 people. Surveys are updated every time you play. With hundreds of surveys, the game will always be fresh. Create your own look with the player designer and enter your family name too. Play Pass, Steal, and Strike! Survey Says...it’s America's favorite game show!

Source: The Game Website.

89271.name: The Price Is Right (Mobile)
89271.description:
